The oysters were chilled and fresh, it came with a meshed covered lemon and a sauce platter. I dug for the calamari first and tried the marinara sauce, the horse radish, and a vinaigrette dip. All were tasty, but the spicy marinara was my favorite. For the oysters, I did a simple squeeze of lemon and a dab of sriracha. I wish they had some ponzu sauce which would have given it a nice citrus/soy sauce taste. 

Our server often checked on how we were doing. We teased him to just take a seat and grab a few oysters when we overheard how he has been working long hours. :P The ambiance here is relaxing. There are hanging artificial fish and in the center is a real aquarium with live fish swimming about. Sadly we were too full to try the buffet here, so I'll write about that on my update once I give them a try.

3.5 stars
I've been here several times. My goto is the Pacifica sandwich or fish and chips. The soup is pretty good too. I've had the lobster bisque and clam chowder. Both good. I have had the ayce sushi before and will probably never order it again. It was ok, but just ok and the sushi service is sometimes very slow. Service is hit or miss.

Third time here. First review tho. They are remodeling now. All the hanging Fishes, and Ocean stuff are gone.
So for the Family Experience... don't come anytime soon.

Anyways just having bowl of clam chowder. Lots seafood but this time the chowder was rather spicy. Not sure from what kind of pepper. Maybe white. But not sure.  Some may like it. Not too creamy. Nor Overwhelmed with Potatoes. Good clam.

Sourdough was ok. Not as wonderful as at  "The Timbers" at Tahoe's Lakeside Inn Casino. But good.

Noticed total Yelp  reviews been 3 stars. The Interior is so so so So Very bland at this time. For now Im just copying Yelps 3 stars. And give my Chowder to one of my Roomies. Will try the Chowder again after their remodel. The Chowder really did'nt even Taste close to our prior visits. Which was  4.5 stars. Why did they change it???????

]

Had a few beers and some sushi here this past week.  The beer was great, but the sushi was???  With the exception of Uni which tasted somewhat fresh, the rest of my sushi was less than desirable.

A friend once told me "Tony, why would go to Reno and order seafood?  Do you see any oceans?" 

I think my buddy has a point.

Lobster bisque was yummy.

Prices are reasonably good for being inside a hotel/casino.

Atmosphere was fun and definitely unique (it feels like you are under the sea!)

Our server was VERY attentive and super friendly- thanks JJ for wonderful service. 

Free drink with check in & entree!

Not a bad try for Japanese inside a hotel casino. We started with the Oceano Nautical Trio, to which the lobster bisque took me by surprise. I loved it more than the clam chowders. So I would have to recommend the trio so that you can sample their fare. We also ordered a Rainbow Roll and Assorted Sashimi to share. The fish will never be as fresh as what you would get in the Bay Area, but it was decent enough to keep me coming back here. It's definitely better than in-room service, I'll tell you that much!

I had a really good dinner here with my family while in Reno for a swim meet.  The waiters were 'fun & flippant' and said that there would be a delay on our sushi order because their ovens weren't working properly-- a problem that they deemed temporary.  "Hmmmm," we thought as they left our large, circular booth table below a glowing jellyfish.  

In the end, we did not experience a delay, likely due to the fact that an oven is not required for sushimaking.  Well.. I guess to be fair, rice needs an oven. . .  Regardless, there was no sushi delay.

As for the meal itself, we only ordered rolls for dinner.  Many of them.  They were enjoyed by all of us.  Yes, the sushi was better when we ate it at 7:00am at Japan's Tsukiji Fish Market.  But bloody hell, this is RENO.  It was plenty good and fine, thank you.

Right in my backyard and I admit I haven't been here in maybe 10 years.  

Recently on short notice I was invited to have sushi here for lunch. Pass up sushi ? No way !   And I'm so glad I didn't. I'm in and out of the Peppermill property all the time but never seem to hit Oceano. That will have to change.  

Located in the north front end of the property, this restaurant has been updated with a bright open atmosphere. The sushi bar is in the back and very large.  Whenever possible I always sit at the bar, I love watching the chefs work and can ask questions about their recommendations and where their fish comes from.  That day I had Resty as my chef, as well as 5 others at my end of the bar. Service was spot on. And he still had time to answer all our questions about the fishes and preparations. 

Wow, the mussels are probably the plumpest ones I've see in town with great flavor and tender.  The menu had some of the usuals from around town, but new and very different creations.  I tried the Baked Alaska and Salmon BTLA rolls. Loved the Alaska, the BLTA was interesting, I did dislike it but would have like more crispy salmon skin in it than bacon.  The nigiri I tried was fresh and on small thumbs of rice. Even the rice had a nice flavor to it.  

If you haven't already, add Oceano to your Reno AYCE sushi list.  Lunch $21 and $30.

The Peppermill is always so much fun! I have find memories of the Peppermill restaurant in San Jose, CA. My family would go on weekends and I have never forgotten the mystical ambiance and the rainbow sugar. 

Well now I have finally made it to the Peppermill, RENV,  woohoo! I woke up and had a hankering for something delicious and light since I have an entire spa day ahead of me and need to be in a bikini. So! Oceano! It was a quick trek from the Tuscan Tower Suites. I arrived and was blown away by the vibrant Ocean decor! Jellyfish chandeliers, dimly lit lighting, reflective ceilings that remind you of bubbles and waves as if you're looking up from the ocean floor. Great whites, giant turtles. It's an underwater fairytale.

The wine selection is nice too. I had the Whitehaven Sauv Blanc. They also offer a Pinot Gri though the Sauv was very crisp and refreshing. There wasn't an over bearing sweetness. 

Now the sushi. The Nigiri is better than the rolls of you are doing the buffet. The buffet isn't super fancy, but it's fun. They offer more elegant choices aside from the saucy Americanized rolls which is the bulk of what makes the buffet. 

I had good service and for all you can eat sushi for 18.99 Uhhh, ya can't beat it. If your taste is more sophisticated I wouldn't completely recommend the buffet, rather the standard menu.

Service was also exceptional!

Whenever we are in town, we stop off at this restaurant for fresh seafood. We took our friend here who lives in Reno.
Our server, Michael, was fantastic. He knew the menu and made suggestions which we really enjoyed. His personality made our dinner experience very enjoyable.
We started off with a pineapple margaritas and lemon drop martini which were all great. Our friend ordered the pan seared scallops and my wife had the New England Clam Chowder, crab cocktail with spicy tuna roll. She was not disappointed. I enjoyed the upside down shrimp, quail egg tobiko shooter, California Supreme roll with real crab and Unagi Nigri. All the choices we made were delici

We love this seafood restaurant. We come here for dinner whenever we travel to Reno.
This place used to have neon displays all over the place. Now it looks so open and inviting with huge screens showing photos from different parts of the world.
We weren't hungry, so i had their Seafood pho and my wife had the Dungenous Crab Salad. 
Even tho' the Pho had a great mixed of fresh seafood and the flavor of the soup was not quite there , i'd go to a Vietnamese restaurant  instead.
The server was friendly but kept us waiting for the check. He apologized saying that he grabbed the wrong check and also there was a computer issue. I don't think so.
Anyway. Give this restaurant a try. It's located in the Peppermill Casino.

The atmosphere is gargantuan but very artistically and aesthetically interesting, but even better, the seafood here is surprisingly great for Reno and a casino. I enjoyed freshly dipped corn meal calamari that was addictive, and a delicious sole in brown butter sauce and delicious veggies. The service was timely and helpful. Kudos.

Went here for Father's day.  Been numerous times before.

Ambiance/Atmosphere
Cool Reno Casino look and feel.  Peppermill has a certain way with led lighting, glass and neon.  They do it pretty well.  Not great but pretty well.

Service
Every time we go to Oceano our service has been lackluster.  It seems like this place is a triple A ball club of a restaurant for the Peppermill.  You have servers coming up the ladder trying to get to the Steak House or you have people who couldn't cut it in the "Bigs" of fine dining so they are relegated here to mid level fine dining.  If you like service, this place actually dropped to a 3 star based on it's service.

Food
Warm Sourdough Bread.  Amazingly tasty warm and delicious Sourdough bread.  BEST IN TOWN.  Oyster sampler on the half shell.  Bits of shell in a few....not really a lot of difference in flavor between the types...but still better than the crap they serve on the buffets.  But really the star here is the Oceano salad.  If you like bay shrimp, order it.  No seriously just order it.  I've gone here just for this $6 salad.  It's great.  Sushi here is unreportable.  We have done it twice but at a table with non sushi friends.  We will be going soon to give a justfiable review of just the sushi.

Value
A little pricey in some areas...but keep an eye out for different deals and it becomes a really affordable mid level dining experience.

I was recently in the peppermill casino for a conference, wasn't really feeling the buffet so I decided to give Oceano a try.  There is an all you can eat option but this time around I elected to just order a couple of rolls to take back to my room since it was already pretty late and I just wanted to watch Thursday night football.  I ordered the rainbow roll and the spider roll.  The amount of fish on the rainbow roll was kind of skimpy, but the overall size of the roll was decent, a mouthful per slice.  Overall for two rolls it came out to over $23 dollars, so still quite pricey.  If your looking for cheaper eats in the hotel, the sports deli is quite good.

Happy Hour Monday- Friday from 4-7 p.m.


Specialty drinks such as Sake Bombs, Hawaiian Punch, and Apple Saketinis, along with $1 Domestic beers. 

Savor freshly shucked Oysters on the Half Shell for only .99 each!

Bar menu features Catfish Bites for $3.99, Garlic Herb Fries for $1.99 and other delicious bites!

We went here when it was packed so our wait time was 40 minutes.  Overall it was a great experience.  I order the dungeness crab salad which was awesome. They give you quite a bit, plus the avocado as well.  Vegetables were fresh as well. My wife ordered the sushi, I did not have the nigiri, but had the blta roll which I really liked quite a bit and the oceano roll which was good too.  We did not eat all you can eat though as I was full from yesterday's buffet.  Service was pretty good, I checkin and we got a free beer which was awesome.
It's nice seafood place sushis and rolls are really good. Service is good. Comfortable and nice atmosphere. Cocktail was so so

I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the seafood here! Fresh, flavorful oysters on the half shell to start. The oysters were clearly fresh and not the flavorless improperly stored type (like I had at Yankee Pier on a recent visit).

The shrimp and crab louie salad I ordered as my main course was huge filled with a generous portion of chunk dungeness crab and shrimps. Half of a perfectly ripe avocado and fresh salad greens. Lovely!!

They bring you half a loaf of sourdough bread to munch on - not the best sourdough bread I have ever had, but definitely fresh.

Decent service, gaudy decor - you never quite forget that you're in Reno, but at least the quality of the food was a pleasant surprise and the service was good.

They also have an all you can eat Sushi Bar, but eating sushi in Reno just didn't sound like a good idea. I knew I was taking a chance with the oysters, but it turned out to be better than okay!! So the sushi bar is okay as well...

Awesome lobster bisque and arugula salad. So many pieces of really lobster in the soup! Every casino restaurant has some kind of lobster soup but this one is beyond! The server was super goofy and friendly and super TALL lol all and all good experience

Everything about this place is great! The food, service,  decor & even the bread! All dishes were so fresh & appetizing. Great place for seafood in Reno!  

Just like the other yelpers review stated... make sure to have an RSVP for the all you can eat sushi! The wait was too long so we just decided to sit at a table & order from the regular menu.

It took one hour for miso soup and edamame. Need I say more?!

If I need to say more, then I'll say service in that hour was friendly, and our drinks were refilled once, but a hour for soup.... really?!

We've been here twice. Service at the bar was kind of awful, but within the restaurant it was great.  Our bartender didn't even salt our edamame (and we've had it sitting inside - it should come with salt).  Their rolls are big, fish is fresh, and prices are good.  But service at the bar was inexcusable.

Good seafood option inside the Peppermill Hotel and Casino.

I like their selection that focuses but not limited to seafood. Had a hard time selecting  a plate so went with a little bit of everything and got the West Coast Cioppino for $22.00.

For those not familiar with this dish, this is a mix of seafood in a soup...here is what this version had: Crab, Clams, Shrimp, Scallops, Lobster and Fish in spicy Tomato Broth with toasted Ciabatta.

I really enjoyed this plate, the variety, the taste and portion size.

They also do all you can eat sushi: lunch $17.99 (11:30AM-4:00PM) and dinner $24.99 (4:00PM-close). Something I can try next time. 

Service was good but cigarette smell does come in form the casino floor.

I am a very simple guy who likes to eat nigiri sushi with the rice and raw fish on top and lil bit of wasabi and soy sauce. so I come here for their lunch buffet usually for under 20 bucks. and I order their nigiri sushi which is a pretty good selection for the price paid. the sushi is good quality and professional the seaweed is crisp and not soggy. they also offer free miso soup with the buffet which is a plus. they also have sushi rolls but im not a fan of those. but love it every time I come to reno I visit. service is average nothing outstanding at least they come and check up on me.
The service was quick and the salmon skin roll will keep me coming back. The ambiance reminds you of a ride at Disneyland but for the 2 year old, that was only a bonus!
The sushi all you can eat special is totally worth it.  The sushi here was soooooo delicious.  There was about a 15 minute wait, at 9pm on a Sunday night.  Not bad.

Hey there, new favourite "Asian fusion" restaurant (whatever that means). Located quite a ways down 82 Ave, I had driven past dozens of times but never gone out of my way to check it out. My cousin and her BF were in town from Calgary for the weekend and they were really craving Thai, so we took the drive over here.

I'm SO glad we came here. The types of dishes are pretty wide-ranging, so I don't know if I'd strictly call it Thai food, but it was dang delicious. The ever-popular order of green onion cakes and spring rolls for appies was a fantastic decision. Cheap and filling - I couldn't even finish my entree! 

My tasty beef stirfry was just the right amount of spice. Big thumbs up for the descriptions on the menu, too. From "mildly spicy" to "spicy," and even a few that read, "spicy!!!!!" (I love spicy food and my husband doesn't, but he often ends up ordering items at restaurants much spicier than they sound. The descriptions here were right on the money, so this place will be a sure bet for our next dinner date.)

Not too busy, but a warm atmosphere all the same. Our server was great, too.

Oh - oh oh! I almost forgot. Order the bucket of coconut rice - you'll be very glad you did!

I've been here a bunch of times over the past bunch of years. I've enjoyed thai food, Vietnamese food, Chinese food and other dishes at this place. The room dividers are not sturdy and the tables should not be moved as a result. But service is generally pretty good (go to the cash register to pay), and the restaurant has never been terribly packed during my visits. Portion sizes are substantial and the menu has many options available. 

Generally people in the groups I am in have no trouble finding something to eat upon a visit here. It isn't fancy but it is a decent place for a meal.

This wasn't a bad little strip mall Mexican restaurant. It was pretty clean and the menu was pretty large. I ate lunch here on a Saturday afternoon with two other people. I ordered a Quesadilla that had beans, chorizo, cheese, and a few vegetables in it. Not something I'd normally order but it was good. I asked for no sour cream but there was still a little dollop on the plate. Since it wasn't touching the quesadilla no problem. My two lunch dates enjoyed their meals and we were on our way. I'd return.

You walk into what can only be described as someone vomited up bright colors.  Wow.  Burns your eyes it's so tropical in there!

The thing that saves this place:  bowl o' chihuahua cheese.  They don't know how to make this stuff in Chicago.  We *almost* delayed the drive home to pick some up to-go as a road trip snack!

Taco salad though, not good.  I asked for no sour cream, but I think between the guacamole and the grease from the chicken, it ended up making taco salad gray soup in the bottom of my shell.  I picked at it but ultimately ended up making do with more cheese and chips!

The cheese is good, the Diet Coke is fountain and the chairs have different brightly colored animals and birds on them.  If we weren't on this side of town, I wouldn't make a special trip for it.

I visited Las Fuentes today. This little place is great. The menu is full of great items. I know this seems immature, but I like the menu because it is very descriptive and has pictures for most of their dishes. 

I tried the fish tacos. They were not all that authentic but they were very good. And the plate came with 4 of them plus rice and beans. I also tried the Alambra dish. This was very good too with different meats (I think chorizo, ham, and beef) served over corn tortillas. I also tried a chile relleno as a side. This too was very good. 

This place is a bit of a drive for me so I'm not sure I will be back anytime soon. But I highly recommend it for anyone looking for some good Mexican food in the oakville area.

First, ignore the view outside the restaurant because you are not taking a scenic drive nor eating with a majestic view of nature while at The Piston.  What you are getting is a bright, friendly and welcoming interior to enjoy meals with friends & family.

There are incredible specials at this friendly diner!  You are treated as someone special when you enter the diner.  The prices will never damage your wallet or purse.

This visit was for one of those after-church breakfast/lunch meals.  Our entire group opted for breakfast although the lunch choices all were appealing in their description.

Our waitress not only appeared to love her job but she was an excellent resource on menu choices.  Megan went with the stuffed French Toast recommendation and it was perfection on a plate!

My Aspen omelet was stuffed with meat, cheese and veggies.

The only let down and it was worth a star reduction was the coffee.  Weak burnt and perhaps the end of the breakfast hour's coffee but not the kind of coffee you want with a "perfect" breakfast.

Good news on the jelly front .... Smuckers Orange Marmalade & Strawberry Jam with no signs of Mixed Fruit Jelly.

I have to thank my non-meat eating 17 year old son for this chance meeting I had last night. He was out all afternoon. But when he drove up, of course he hadn't eaten. So I hopped in my car to find him something. 
A perfect time to stop in Piston Diner. (the options are slim where I live). 
I was greeted by the hostess, then waitress... Both pleasant ladies... Once I started asking for vegetarian meals, that's when the waitress brought over the owner and head chef. Introduced them to me, and they both started telling me plenty of off menu options. The chef gave me a bowl of bread pudding while I was thinking over what to order... I eventually ordered a penne dish, with spinach, broccoli, peppers, mushroom, onions, and Alfredo sauce... I chose a cabbage soup to go with it. But wound up eating it myself since it had beef in it. 
Between the four helpful people I met, and the huge menu to choose from with various specials and mini meals, I think I found my new go to spot just outside of my neighborhood.

I need to review my reviews because I am so sure that I have already posted a PISTON five star review but what the heck never hurts to sing praises for a customer friendly good eating restaurant!!!

Please note THE PISTON now closes at 3PM!  On a prior stop we talked with the owner who explained the value of family time versus always working.  A great choice especially since it brings extra energy to breakfasts and lunches.  Give me happy management & you get happy staff and you get great service.  Each stop that service has shone like a noonday sun!

Our real test of THE PISTON came when we decided to bring 20 friends here on THE PISTON's busiest day, Sunday morning.  Every seat is usually filled and I was just the new guy in town but the staff set up a long table, served my eclectic group of friends with smiles, and the universally clean plates returned to the dishwasher was verification that good food was delivered to each diner.

There are some great breakfast specials before 11 Monday-Friday but all the food has been special!!!

If you are south of philly on the Jersey side of THE RIVER and hungerin' for a good filling breakfast stop by THE PISTON, which is right off the 295!

Hello there, gorgeous!
Unpretentious elegance, 
Fantastic dishes*

*Dim sum style brunch = eating ALL the foods while staring at the beautiful decor and equally attractive staff

The ultimate, very best shrimp francaise I have ever had and it was an appetizer of six  jumbo shrimp, perfectly battered and sauteed to perfection and served in the most luscious lemon, butter and fresh garlic sauce I have ever had! I'm serious, this stuff is addictive! Next time I do believe that I will ask if I can have it over a side of pasta to help lap up all of the incredible sauce! Outstanding!

For my entree I had a huge portion of chicken parmesan, I know, I just can't get enough of that stuff, three large chicken breasts with an enormous portion of spaghetti! I ate all of this for three days!

Hubs got an order of the spaghetti with split grilled sausages, which is exactly how he likes it and both entrees came with a half loaf of bread! Their food is so delicious! 

Since then hubby has stopped in for a hoagie and thoroughly enjoyed it. Both times were take out, I for one will never be able to order from them again without getting the shrimp francaise, truly phenomenal!

I know, technicalities...
Overall good pizza - I will say they do take their time delivering, so be prepared to wait a bit.

Good Italian restaurant, but over priced. Taormina's is a nicer Italian restaurant than most other ones in the area for sure, but the problem with it is that is can be very inconsistent at times. The biggest problem with Taormina's is consistency in terms of food quality. I've come here before and the food is great, other times the chicken tastes dried out and not as flavorful as previous visits. My most recent visit here, I got the Chicken Alfredo with Rigatoni; the chicken was dried out and flavorless, and the Alfredo felt like it had been sitting under a hot lamp for a while, not fresh. I had previously gotten the exact same dish, which I though was fantastic, but that was a few weeks before. My friend also was upset with his dish as he got the Chicken Parmesan, in which the chicken was very chewy and not edible. Again he has had it in the past and it was fine. All of this isn't even mentioning the pricing here is expensive. For literally pasta with chicken in it costs me almost $20, and they don't put that much chicken in the dish. Everything here is a la carte, so with your $20+ meal, you don't get any salad or anything, just some bread and peppers. Sometimes here the food is great, other times it is whatever. It's all the luck of the draw.

The atmosphere is pretty nice in Taormina's; they keep the place very clean and it always looks inviting. The place is pretty small, but they fit a lot of people in there and it doesn't feel too cramped. Service is decent too, never really had a major issue, and whenever their is a problem, the servers seem to be able to fix it somewhat. Basically, if Taormina's priced their meals more reasonably, I'd be a much happier camper, but for the price you pay there, I expect a much better product when I go. I hear the Ivyland location of Taormina's costs even more, so there's that.

Food (B+), Pricing (D+), Atmosphere (B), Service (B)
Very fun - lots of teamwork and communication. My girlfriends and I still had 14 minutes on the clock. Will definitely go to another Escape room again. & Jeff was an awesome host.

Coming from San Jose land of amazing Pho, my expectations are pretty high but I am fully aware Im in Reno.  When that Pho craving calls you must answer the call! 
Not too bad for Reno pho.  But they lost big time on the honey walnut prawns.  Worst I've ever had.  

Ambiance was decent, China feel to it with the chair design and tables.  
Could be a little bit cleaner as far as utensils, chop sticks looked kinda gross had to go though a few to get clean ones.  

Honey walnut prawns were TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE.       WARNING DO NOT ORDER THIS!!!
I've never had any shrimp this bad.  How the hell could they serve that to us?  Shame  shame shame 

Pho : took a long time like 20+ minutes, which tells me they probably used a powder or premix or it was old and they reheated it.  However it was pleasantly decent haha I was surprised.   It wasn't as Hot as I would like it, I like my pho HOT!!!  Meat was tender and tasty, veggies were good.  Would have liked a little bit more flank but it's reno so not bad.  

Service was ok more lackadaisical 

When you need that pho fix I'd consider coming back but I'd want to venture to find better first.

This is a regular stop whenever I come to Reno to get away from California life.   The place is clean and service can be hit or miss.  The Pho broth is much better than at Golden Flower down the street.   

Restaurant is clean and can get busy since it's right on the downtown casino strip.

Was in Reno for the holidays and caught the Warriors game at Silver Legacy. During half time got hungry and nothing was open at Silvery Legacy and I didn't feel like waiting in line at the Circus Circus food court. The location is literally outside across the street so you cant miss it. There is a Mcds couple doors down but bleh fast food. The place was decent for what it was. We ordered the spring rolls, egg rolls, pho, chicken rice plate, and couple beers. The food was mediocre. Only thing that was good was the eggrolls. We originally ordered pork rice plate but chicken came out. The chicken was yellow tinted and thin strips and didn't look appealing at all. They messed up on our pho. We wanted extra noodles on the side and they brought out a side of raw meat. Not sure if there was a miscommunication or language barrier. Service wasn't great and they seem rude and wanted us in and out.

I came here with my family at around 11am, no lines and we were seated right away. It took them over 30 minutes to bring out my family's food! Even something as simple as Pho should NOT take that long to bring out. I ordered the number 41, the canh bun. It has good flavor but was very lacking in noodles. I only got like 3 balls of meat in my dish as well. The pho broth is pretty normal, nothing special. My younger brother's rice dish with grilled chicken and shrimp was pretty good though! The chicken was extremely tender and the shrimp was also cooked well. Pho Cali is good if your family have the Viet food cravings after splurging on American buffets over at Circus Circus/Silver Legacy, but don't expect to get in and out very quickly.

Sometimes I'd rather have a nice, hot bowl of noodle soup over the staple American style breakfasts with eggs.  I was elated to discover Pho Cali but not only that!  They open at 10am- perfect timing for breakfast!  

I gladly deviated from our casino hotel twice over our 2 night stay to get my fix here.  They take a little longer to bring food out than I'm used to, but the freshness explains the timing.  The shrimp and pork rice spring rolls were made to order with a peanut sauce.  I could make a meal out of these, easy.  The roasted duck noodle soup exceeded my expectations.  I expected shreds of duck meat in the broth, but instead I was served a generous Peking style duck leg, thigh and other chopped pieces on bone.  Cabbage, green onions and thin egg noodles completed this hearty soup.  On my next visit, I had the rare steak pho with flank and brisket.  It was delicious and regenerated the life inside me after a long night at the casino playing blackjack and sipping on cocktails for hours.  We also ordered the Vietnamese pancake which had shrimp, chicken and bean sprouts inside a crepe style pancake.  It was yummy and definitely a gluttonous addition to our large pho's.

I love this place.  It's a clean establishment, and a family run business with friendly, attentive service.  The food is excellent, and extremely reasonable prices!  I'll be sure to grace Pho Cali with my presence whenever in Reno!

+1 for having a drive-through. Although, it does not have a screen showing you your order and total. 

Stopped by spontaneously while in the area and ordered their 2-piece thigh and drumstick $5 fill-up, which came with mashed potatoes, a drink, and a cookie. Pretty good deal for $5!

You can an additional side for $1. The menu didn't  say that the price was only for ONE side. I added three sides. Two were charged at their regular $2.49 price. In hindsight, it would have been cheaper to just get two $5 fill-ups and add one extra side to both for $1

The mashed potatoes and gravy reminded me of childhood lunches at KFC with my family. It tastes the same as it did 30 years ago!

KFC - despite PETA boycotting the place I still go there from time to time when I'm in the mood to work on the clogging of my arteries..... which is an art form in and of itself  :-)

KFC back in Texas is either different or just managed better, because I've been to two different KFC's in Reno and both - were really lacking.
In fact I've yet to find a great place to get fried chicken in Reno! When is Churches Chicken? Where is Popeye's? Where is Williams Chicken (aka Ghetto Chicken)

I see a KFC commercial on TV and they are making their newest "deal" look and sound like a dream come true...... only to find out its more of the same - arranged in a new fancy box, or container...... they should have just said NEW BOX - because its the SAME OLD CHICKEN!!

3 things at KFC that are consistently good - cole slaw - biscuits - mash potatoes with brown gravy. The mash potatoes are GOOD in that NASTY sort of instant way! Still I love them.

I think KFC needs to reinvent itself one more time! 

Good things I like about the place is parking is easy if you choose to go in..... the drive thru is quick.... its about $20 bucks for 2 people. 

The only REALLY bad thing I HATE about this place is when going through the drive thru...... its almost impossible for the passenger to see all of the menu.... that annoys me to no end.

This location is back behind Marsh in a strip of businesses that are basically dying.  All of the DQ's in this east side vicinity are older and in need of upgrades, but this location has kept up with giving us quality product.  The staff has been friendly, and they have continued maintain their business in an area that has been hard hit by urban decay. We appreciate their longevity.

Meh. There was an entire bar dedicated to salad items, another for fried and "non-Chinese" stuff and only one for the Chinese food, which included beef and brocolli, chicken in sauce, battered chicken in sauce, fried rice, lo mein and some other things. Really not that great.

The sushi selection was much better and it was well stocked with new stuff being made and laid out constantly while I was here. A few of the usual California rolls but some tuna ans salmon rolls as well as one with shredded "Krab" on top.\\

I was able to find a quiet booth in the corner which was nice until the party of 14 sat next to me. Bummer.

I opted not to visit the teppanyaki grill.

It's two stars for me. I've experienced better.
There are a lot to pick from to eat,  Chinese, Korean and Japanese selections are offerred to eat.  Additionally a salad and dessert bar is present.  Overall the food is good.

For a typical Chinese buffet (but with a Japanese name?), it has a slightly more impressive selection with the same, average buffet quality - they have oysters on the half shell, crawfish, lots of crabs, a hibachi grill, a pretty solid sushi selection, and a chocolate fountain. Obviously quality is sacrificed at a buffet, but this place is so cheap, who's complaining, right? I was stuffed here with pretty good tasting food. 

Lowlights - fat free ice cream was terrible and obviously filled with artificial sweeteners (my siblings got the fat free while I opted for the regular fatty ice cream, which was extremely creamy), and the service. Service was terrible - we had to wait quite a while for our used/dirty plates to be cleared so our table was constantly cluttered with dirty plates as we progressed throughout our meal.

It's a standard buffet, what more do you want for $12.95?

The buffet was a great experience! the seating arrangement was comfortable and the food was very well prepared and they offered a wide variety of foods. They brought out fresh seafood often and the meats were very fresh. Sushi bar was ok, and the dessert bar was full! Cake, ice cream, and sweets of all kinds! Oh, and did I mention a very satisfying chocolate fountain? I was able to coat strawberries in chocolate, which was superb.

All in all, it was a great experience with great food.

Obsessed with this place. Haven't actually been there but after living in South Jersey for over a year we struggled with finding a reliable place with not just good pizza but good food across the board. This is now our go-to place for pizza and everything else on the menu.
Cool market. Don't come here that often, but good spot to shop when on a budget. Great location with plenty of parking. You can find many shops just seconds away.

I realize that there have been mixed reviews on this place, but I had a good visit. Two coworkers and I went over here for lunch one day and we were seated almost immediately, received decent service, and enjoyed delicious food. My coworkers both got the pulled pork sandwich and I got the stuffed BBQ burger. They let you choose your side so I got some greens, which were pretty good. I like that this is close to where I live and I plan to hopefully take advantage of the grocery side of the business.

A friend is in town to visit the law school at Tulane and we can't go very far during my lunch break, so I'm thinking of taking him here today.

I'm actually really surprised about the poor reviews this place has received.  I've only had good experiences!

The people have always been friendly, I've never had to wait, and the barbecue is on point!  I like the babyback ribs with the collard greens and macaroni and cheese.  You really can't go wrong with the barbecue.  I've also had breakfast sitting at the bar, and people remembered me on my second visit.  

Give them a chance!

Awesome barbecue. We got the platter to split. Originally ordered half chicken, ribs, and brisket. They didn't have any chicken ready, so we got pulled pork instead. That was the only disappointment. Got collard greens and cheddar bacon mashed potatoes as sides. The potatoes were phenomenal. The meat was all cooked very well, with just enough seasoning and sauce. We also got the breakfast biscuits to go with the meal, and they were a tremendous complement to the meat. All in all, we left full and very satisfied. $41 after tax and tip

All the meh reviews had me feeling a little dubious about this place, but my roommate and I went here for breakfast yesterday, and we adored it. The service was impeccable; our waiter was super sweet! The ambiance of the place is old school and modern and the names on the menu are super cute (WOMELETTE?!) My roommate ordered the TREE HUGGER BENNIE: 3 poached eggs, mushrooms, tomato, spinach on toasted English muffin, with hollandaise sauce, and I got the GULF COAST OMELET and added spinach: fresh local crabmeat, marinated smoked feta, tomato, fresh herbs. Mine was $10, my roomate's was $11, they also had some delectable-looking cakes; each slice was about 5 inches tall... I'll be back.

I have no words for this establishment besides good riddens. I recommended this place to my boss. We went in, ordered the salad and an entree - turkey chilli. The server was not well prepared, in fact he was new. I am not opposed to being served by a newby, but get the proper training.  I really don't blame him, I blame management. Anywhooo, back to my story. He brought gumbo to the table..HELLO, I love gumbo but was not planning on sticking my spoon in any during this lunch. To add insult to injury, the gumbo was loaded with meat. I don't eat all kinds of meat. I was mortified. I panicked at gagged.Totally embarrassed. The 'new' waiter states that he just started this job and apologized. I asked for the manager. She came, wet her whistle and left. I don't remember what she said besides we will comp you. All in all, my experience was not pleasant. I really like the parking but the food makes me extremely nervous. Hence, I would not recommend Fat Hen for anything more than convenience. The service is horrible.
I had the Tree Hugger Benedict with a side of sausage.. Dang good. This is the place to go for a lazy Sunday breakfast, then a small walk in the park with the wife..

It's a fine place to have an ordinary lunch at expense account prices. Everything is a la carte. A Reuben, potato salad and drink were $20.00. None is these items are super-sized (for those who like to bring home a portion of their meals). Staff is affable and slick up-sellers. Very homey atmosphere.

Went back here with a friend from out of town as I said I would in my previous review. This time I ordered some ribs. I got the quarter rack St. Louis style ribs. $9. I thought this was a good deal, because I got a salad, then the ribs came on a platter with a biscuit and a side (I got some potato salad). Definitely enough for me, and I eat. I will admit that I am the farthest thing away from being a BBQ connoisseur but I thought it was delicious. My friend Kyle ordered the Little Piggy and seemed to enjoy it very much.

Service is slow, and this normally would not have been an issue for me, but my friend had to be somewhere at a specific time, so we were rushed. So much so that I had to bring some of the food back to work and eat at my desk. Haha. Our server was very nice though and I still think I'd go back.

Good bang for your buck.

Wanting to have buffet in Reno that is not located in a Casino and something different from the usual fare, I searched Yelp for buffets and this placed popped up. I just wanted to escape having to smell another cigarette smoke that is extremely suffocating. I called and discovered lunch was only $7.99. Why so cheap, I wondered. I read the other reviews and in Yelpers I trusted. 

Located just a mile or so from the strip and parking is located in their back lot. Area looked clean and safe so we proceeded inside. Interior and furniture looked nice and they had a bar in the back and the buffet table on the other side. One thing I noticed was there was not one Indian soul working in the restaurant so I had a slight hesitation but quickly vanished once I glanced on the buffet table and saw something familiar. The server asked us if we were there for the buffet and told us to grab a plate. 

The server started us with some Garlic Naan bread that was very good. They have the usual Chicken Tandoori, Tikki Masala, Lamb Curry, Potatoes, Rice, Veggies, Chutneys etc...that are a staple in a typical AYCE Indian cuisine. We were not disappointed one bit. All the familiar flavors, spices and texture were present and very comforting. Service was also exceptional as they kept refilling our glasses without even asking. 

I probably had one plate too many (I had three) since I had to drop a deuce in their very clean toilet. Yes it was nice and clean, and I know it's T.M.I. 

But it is what it is!

My only negative comment would be that I was looking forward to some Bollywood movies as mentioned in other reviews, but it was a Sunday and all their monitors had on the Steelers vs. Redskins on TV. All is forgiven, except I couldn't stop comparing the throwback jerseys the Steelers were wearing looked similar in color to what I left in the......never mind.

Oh yeah....I'd come here again. But next time I'll keep it to two plates.

I eat here about once a month and like it but they really knocked it out of the park today. The spinach and garlic soup was fantastic and I got seconds. Same for the cauliflower and potato dish. Perfectly cooked and the cauliflower tasted like it was picked this morning. It was lightly seasoned with something, I'm not sure what. Saffron? And this was the buffet.
Most of the rest of the buffet was good today. As usual, the tandoori chicken was a let down. I guess it's not economical to do a quality tandoori chicken for the buffet.

LOVE THIS PLACE!  I would go here any day.  They have great food, nice and spicy, and a beautiful and warm atmosphere.  The tikka masala is always a favorite, as well as the garlic naan, and anything off their veggie menu.  I particularly love the lentil dishes.

It's hard to really give a place a good review when you eat the lunch buffet.  But I will try my best.  We were sat promptly and asked if we wanted to do the buffet and we said yes because we were pressed for time.   The daughter really doesn't even come close to eating much so we just ordered her a mango lahsi and some naan.  We did everything on the bar and there was nothing that was unexpectedly bad.  There were some new things to us.  Aloo Tikki was real yum.  I can't actually compare it to any other Aloo Tikki, because I hadn't ever had it.  But it seemed to be cooked skillfully.  So the food was good the buffet had a nice wide variety of chutney's and condiments.  The naan was good and warm.
  A few low spots detracted from the experience.  The plate and water service was good but it seemed that everyone was a little grumpy, almost like they all had a pretty hard night of drinking before but still came in with a hangover.  Now maybe it's just me but this seems to be standard for Indian restaurants in Reno.  There was one that didn't have that attitude, sadly they aren't in business anymore.  So maybe it's just me.  However I don't go to restaurants to make friends but to have good food.
  I will return.  And some day I will return and actually try a real meal, not just the buffet.

Nothing Great...not terrible. It did quench my appetite for Indian.

Vegetable Samosa were plain. Won't get again.  Jhinga Chaat (Shrimp Chaat) was the best overall dish we had. Good flavor.  Will explore the chaat's more on future visits.

Mulligatawany Soup was just ok.

Garlic Naan was awesome. Cooked perfectly and was very light.

Dahi Bhala (Lentil Dumplings) also very plain. They weren't dumplings...more like lentil donuts swimming in cucumber yogurt.

Saag Paneer was most disappointing... reminded us of creamed spinach. 

Murg Tikka Masala... the sauce was very plain. Had a "tomato from the can" kind of flavor. However, the tandori chicken in the dish was FANTASTIC.

Everything lacked flavor and spice. We ordered Medium and got bland.  We will go back only after exploring other Indian options.

I've only ever had dinner here before, so when I drove by the other day looking for a place to lunch and saw the sign "$6.95 Lunch Bufffet," I was all, "Yum!  Cheap and delicious!"  And it was.  The food was fresh and tasty, and you just can't beat that price.  Although this restaurant is in a fairly inconvenient location, it is really nice, with lovely decor and good service.  They've recently added two plasma televisions with which to air Indian music videos--videos which teetered very precariously on the border of soft-core porn, if you're into that sort of thing.  It can be hard to find parking for this place, but overall well worth the effort for a delicious and ridiculously cheap lunch.

I've been here twice for the lunch buffet, both times I loved it. Its $7.99. The food is wonderful, not overly spiced with curry, and you dont leave there smelling like you've been in a fight with a sack of curry powder!! They have both spicy and mild dishes, as well as vegetarian. Their buffet also offers a salad bar to go along with your lunch. 

The only thing lacking as far as food goes, is I love dessert and really the only thing I found was some mixed fruit. Both times I've been there, they had different dishes on the buffet, so its nice to get a variety each time I go so I can try new things!!

I'm still fairly new to Indian cuisine so I make it a point to sample a little of everything on the buffet, and both times I've done this everything I ate was very good. The first time I went there, some of the dishes were too hot and spicy so my dining partner asked for something less spicy so they totally prepared her a dish without spice and even gave her a to-go container to take her leftovers home. The staff is very friendly, the restaurant and the bathrooms both are very well decorated, and very clean. They offer a full bar if drinking is you thing. The Bollywood videos are entertaining. This is my FAVORITE Indian food place so far!!! 

The only reason I did not give this place 5 stars is the parking is a little difficult because its behind the building, and your not sure if you are parking in their designated spots or the other businesses who share the lot. My suggestion is they mark their parking spots better.

The food was extremely fresh. Getting there 20 minutes after opening-time was a good idea! Well, not to say it wouldn't be fresh otherwise, but...yeah. It was our first time here. Lunch buffet, FYI.

The outside is very unassuming. The inside...beautiful lighting. Very clean. Very polite staff. 

My most favorite, FAVORITE thing from Indian restaurants is lamb saag. Followed closely by saag paneer. Hey, I just freaking love saag. This place had saag, but in the form of chana saag, which I haven't had before, but thoroughly enjoyed. The cauliflower pakora was amazing. Not too fried or greasy. The chicken masala was pretty outstanding. Huge chunks of chicken in an amazing sauce. 

They give you a choice of regular or garlic naan. This thrilled me. The naan took a moment to bring out because it was obviously being made fresh. It was SO good.

Minus one star for beef curry. The meat was tough, the sauce was pretty flavorless as far as curry goes, and only really tasted like...meat.  And additionally...beef curry? I won't say any more.

I also love tamarind chutney and this place does it right! I'm also very used to Indian places having firni as a dessert, but this one had 'fruit creme' which was pretty darn good. It was some sort of mango creme with different little chunks of fruit in it. By the time I finished my tiny bowl, it really reminded me of melted ice cream. It was good, though!

If I go to Reno again, I think I will want to come here again, but I REALLY hope they have a lamb dish next time.

I ordered the chicken tikka masala.  It was better than average but nothing too special.  The chicken was very tender but it tasted a bit fake to me, just a bit too soft as if it was processed somehow.  I have been to at least 50 indian restaurants including 3 weeks in India so I guess I am a bit picky.

Dinner Menu for 3:
Appetizer: Chef's sampler - it's ok; the tamarind sauce is good; I won't order again
Masala Dosa - good
Lamb Curry - good
Vegetable Korma - good
Basmati Rice - very good

We all liked what we ordered and left full. I liked having the choice of spice level. I ordered mild and it was just right.

Lunch buffet for $7.95? Sold!

It was a crappy Saturday afternoon & we wanted something fast but tasty, so when we passed by the restaurant, we made a u-turn & headed in.  The buffet was simple, only six or seven main dishes, but everything was delicious. I love raita, the yogurty lemony sauce that I generously topped on everything. The curry was good, but the standout dishes were the chicken tikka and masala, plus the fragrant rice.

Other than the grumpy staff, we enjoyed the quick meal and will certainly return.

Totally chill and awesome bookstore café.  Every neighborhood in the world should have a place like this. Some evenings there are free concerts or movies. They are open most of the day and night. Staff is friendly. And they have both Bassett's and Weckerly's Ice cream ... as well as rugelach. How can you go wrong spending time at Read & Eat?
IT was just ok.  I ordered a chicken sandwich, but the sandwich looked like something I could have made at home.  I will have to try the desserts next time and write a follow up review.

My fiancé and I have driven by Culver's countless times saying "we need to try this place!!!" and finally, on Saturday, we did. The service was fast and friendly and our order came out sans problemos. We both had cheeseburgers, which were good, but just that. It was nothing that left my tastebuds screaming, "I need to come back for more!!" The fries were more of the same (and I'm a fry fanatic) so I was especially let down by the pretty bland crinkle cuts.  We also split some cheese curds, which were the highlight of the meal... but I was looking forward to a killer burger and fries!!! Our consensus in the end was, if you're looking for a fast food burger that isn't quite "fast food" stick with In&Out or 5 Guys.

Had pretty low expectations coming here, but came away pretty impressed! 

I've been holding off trying this place just because I didn't want to be disappointed, since I was spoiled by dozens of authentic, delicious Chinese food being located in every corner of my hometown. While Lao Wang doesn't necessarily outdo any place, it's still pretty good.

Lao Wang can get pretty busy, so depending on when you come, there may or may not be enough seating. Customer service is brief and largely forgettable. There's additional sauces on a table that's self-serve, and the store seems pretty clean overall.

I got the build-your-own noodles, and chose the rice noodles. My friend got the small pork rib rice bowl. First off, the noodles were well cooked. Not terribly soft, not too hard. The soup wasn't too salty, and the spicy option gave the broth just enough of a kick for flavors to be interesting. There's actually a good amount of noodles and toppings to offset the high-ish price. The pork rib was braised just like mom does it at home; flavor is pretty authentic and well done. The rice and veggie part was pretty average, though. 

I can't guarantee that Lao Wang would do well in my hometown given its prices, but compared to everything else in Isla Vista, it's not too expensive. If you can afford to eat in Isla Vista, and you want some Asian food, you should give Lao Wang a try!

So continues my quest to find good, solid Chinese food in the area. Lao Wang marketed itself as just "Asian street food," which made me sigh because I thought the entire menu was essentially traditional Chinese food, but hey. It's an edible option.

Came in just before 5 (off-hours) and it took them quite a while to get the food out. While my single stewed pork belly bao was out in two minutes, the friend I went with had to wait for 10 to get a small serving of popcorn chicken dusted with white pepper and a boiled (or deep fried?) Chinese sausage. None were particularly special -- pork belly and sausage were both fatty, and while the popcorn chicken uses dark meat, the portion is about one handful for $6. Bao was nicely cooked but bland.

I found a piece of plastic in my bao, but judging from the rushed/low-key grand opening and lackadaisical attitude of the people behind the counter, I didn't have the motivation to go up to the counter and complain about it. The ma la tang sounded and looked quite a bit like Sichuan dandan noodles with soup, though, and I'd be interested in trying that once they settle down more.

On the bright side, they have a massive condiment section. If you cry when you eat red pepper flakes, though, I'd avoid this place. Even their bao has a small smear of chili paste inside (not that you can taste much, anyway).

It's so-so, but could be so much better. This fast food joint focuses on mostly a mix of Chinese food ie Noodles and Baozi Sandwiches, with some random stuff like fries. I had each of the 3 buns they offered, which include the Pork Belly Bao, Popcorn Chicken Bao, and Pork Sausage Bao.

Now the food came out quickly and the texture of both the bun and meats came out nice. The Popcorn chicken and pork sausage both came out as so-so, but for something even less desirable, try the pork belly, which was only slightly more flavorful than tap water. The buns are less oily, but the pork belly and Chicken were cooked with something oily and that texture doesn't leave my mouth very well. From what I saw on the noodles with a friend, it looked way too MSG-ridden with an oily sheen on the top. Anyways, all of them definitely need some work on seasoning or marinade since none of the meats really had any flavor, even with the chili paste.

By themselves overall, the bao buns were not salty nor spicy nor...anything with an actual flavor. For 3 Bao buns, the total came out to be $8.20, which isn't too bad but definitely leaves something to be desired if this is marketed as Asian street food. If the meat had more flavor then I think it would be better justified for the price that they currently have for them.

Ahh..dear sweet Jimmy John's..why do all the men at work love you so? I think your sandwiches are a bit small and standard issue, but you are clean, fast, and friendly. I know you offer little dabs of meat and avocado here and there, but I'm not sure where this avocado paste comes from. Can you spare more than a dollop please I'm starving over here! Do you guys make anything at all in house? I really want to find a reason to love you too, but I haven't yet. I make far more massive sammiches at home wearing only underwear.

I would say it is better than Subway but honestly, is that saying much? Truth be told, they are always friendly and clean which are good things in my book. 

Bottom line - It's a reliable spot for straightforward American sandwiches, when the mood strikes you.

Just fine.  A-OK - not stellar and not bad.  Sweet - run-of-the-mill Thai staples - and they make a decent $9.95 lunch platter with a small cup of soup, mini appetizer (salad ro a few pices of dumpling or other treat) and entree.

Curries are fine - and Pad See Ew is my fave.

It was better when it was Thai Chef - but I am glad they are still here for a once in a while option.  I get take out Thai from Thia Singha House.

This place is great for large groups of hungry Center City workers.  On my last visit, there were at least 3 tables of 4 people who had no problem getting seated at lunch. 

Their lunch deal is one of the better ones around these parts and you don't have to sacrifice taste to get it.   For $12, you get a soup, starter, and entree.  I went with the Pad Thai and it was pretty good.  It wasn't the best, but it was definitely in the top 5, which says a lot.

The only thing is that you will be forced to work through your Thai Food Coma for the rest of the afternoon.  So delicious and so sleepy.

2.5 - It's not very good, but it's passable for Thai food.

I have been a few times, and most recently my friend and I got some takeout from here. We shared the Thai fried rice with seafood and the shrimp pad Thai. I just don't like their pad Thai sauce -- to me, it tastes more like a sweet and sour sauce than what pad Thai should taste like. Both dishes were also pretty oily, and the Thai fried rice was way too salty. The portions were large, but I would prefer eating less of a good dish...

Had the lunch special here with a friend and thought the prices were great. $8.95 lunch special for soup, AND an appetizer, AND an entree. I had the tom cha soup, which has a coconut base, the curry puff as the appetizer, and the chicken pad thai.  I wasn't too impressed with the tom cha soup b/c it mostly tasted like coconut milk boiled with a few mushrooms.  However, the curry puff was crispy and its contents flavorful.  The pad thai was a really generous size and I really liked that they put tofu in it since the pad thais I've tried usually don't have tofu.

What I was especially impressed with was that the staff offered to lend us an umbrella.  When my friend and I came here, the weather was OK but it started pouring rain afterwards.  I had a tiny personal umbrella but my friend didn't.  We asked the waiter what the nearest store to buy an umbrella was, and he told us where the nearest CVS was. Later, he came back and offered to lend us an umbrella to get to CVS.  I was kind of surprised they'd have good faith in us to return the umbrella.  It was definitely a used umbrella but a monster-size one, the kind you want when it's pouring rain like it was today.  So we went out and bought an umbrella then came back and returned theirs.  I'll come back again, not just for the food but for the good faith in umbrella-lending.

Pretty sweet lunch specials, which go until 4 PM!  Depending on your choice of protein, you get a 3-course lunch for $8.95 to $11.95.  Chicken and Beef are in the $8.95 group.  Yes, the portions for the specials are a bit smaller, but I finished my meal and was satisfied knowing I wouldn't be hungry in an hour.

My lunch consisted of Tom Kha Soup, Chicken Curry Puff, and Beef Panang Curry.  The soup was balanced with coconut and no doubt the best part of my meal.  The Chicken Curry Puff was enjoyable, but nondescript. The Panang was solid as well, with a good heavy amount of beef.  However, the curry was not as thick as I'm used to with Panang.  Overall, my first experience told me Bangkok Thai 9 would be worth checking out again for another lunch special.

Great spot for decent Thai food. Lunchtime was busy but it was worth the wait. $8.95 for soup, a spring roll and pad thai and all of them were yummy. I would go back here to try more of their noodle dishes, even w/out the lunch deal.

Almost 3 stars because there are so many better offerings in Philly, especially in the Chinatown area, but other than Erawan and Bangkok Thai 9, Rittenhouse is lacking for the most part - so 4 stars it is! 

---------------------------------------------------

Earlier this year, I was feeling a bit under the weather so was in the mood for some pho after work. Located in the Rittenhouse area, Bangkok Thai 9 seemed to fit the bill. So I stopped by to pick up some pad thai for the GF and pho for me! 

Chicken Pad Thai ($11.95)
Thin rice noodles, chicken, egg, bean sprout, sliced bean curd, crushed peanuts, scallion, tamarind 

The pad thai was filled with chicken, tofu, bean sprouts, peanuts, and scallion. Gluttonous flat noodles were coated with a sweet and savory sauce that coated the mouth nicely, with nuggets of egg throughout. Still this was simply good, not great.

Beef Pho ($9.95)

The beef pho was just what I was looking for - though I've had better. Still, you could see the umami of the stock that goes into this dish. Since this was takeout, the noodles, bean sprouts, and greens were packaged separately.

Mixed together, this was a decent iteration of pho. You could smell the cinnamon and savory sweetness off the bat. While the beef was a bit thick and overcooked, the entirety of the dish was well-seasoned, with the cilantro providing herbaceousness. The mix of fresh veggies and al dente noodles along with the great stock helped to clear any congestion. A few squirts of sriracha added in? Even better!

So if you're far from Chinatown and need a quick hit of Thai food or pho, stop by Bangkok Thai - they serve up decent renditions.

Kinda wish I walked an extra few blocks to go to other thai places instead. :-( So so sad. A friend and I wanted to do a different place, but it was closed, so we opted for the next closest thing...this place. Service was extremely fast and nice, but the food was severely lacking. We both ordered off of the lunch menu.

Tom yum soup - where is the flavor??? it tasted like tomato to me. No spicyness or sourness to it.

Spring Roll - this was actually pretty good. I enjoyed the nice crisp and the stuffing inside was flavorful.

Beef Pad See ewe - So, I asked for this thing to be thai spicy (normally isn't a spicy dish, but other thai places make it spicy for me). The guy said ok. The thing came out with not even a single pepper flake. I ate it and NO SPICE!!!! I had to ask for peppers on the side. I like it so much better when it's cooked with spice. It soaks it up more! This dish was ok, but it could have been sooo much better. If only they got my order right, they might have gotten better than 2 stars.

interior... pleasing
menu... full of options

chicken satay app... yummm and piping hot
chicken thai basil... spicy and full of fresh veggies
thai iced tea... super sweet, i was warned.

Very meh Thai food that is overly salty although the service was good. The green curry and basil tofu were not very flavorful or spicy but they were extremely salty. It will do in a pinch but Erawan is right around the corner.
Great service, and attentive to this picky vegan. The lunch special is a good deal, but the food itself I thought was just OK. Not bad, but not wonderful.

Definitely not as good as Thai Chef and Noodle Fusion, but still decent Thai food for center city.  Lunch special is $8.95 for soup, appetizer, entree.  They were pretty stingy with the tom kha, and there was no chicken in it.  The spring roll was tasty, but small.  My pad see ew was pretty good.  Only ate half so bonus leftovers for lunch tomorrow.  I did ask them to make it spicy and it really wasn't.  My thai iced tea was a little too sweet.  Service was efficient, although the one waiter seemed like he was scared of us.  He stood really far away from the table when delivering and clearing plates.

We decided to explore the area when we started getting hungry. I yelped the closest chipotle and we followed the directions to this chipotle at PH. This chipotle (and its bathroom) was clean and it has a great outdoor seating area. We ordered 2 sofritas salads (To my surprise, even my carnivore fiancee tried and loved the sofritas so much that he ordered it). Overall, It was a good portion (not stingy) and sans the subpar service from the Chipotle at Countryside mall, so i would definitely  return.

New, this Chipotle location has a clean, industrial and edgy vibe to it. The staff was friendly,  the service was fast, and the food appeared to be fresh

I got myself a bowl, made with the barbocoa beef, rice and beans, I added guacamole and sour cream, got chips and a drink and paid a total of $13.13 (the guacamole was $1.95 add on) 

It tasted good, I won't lie, I enjoyed it,  but hated that the music was blaring at above conversation level. Wit their open air atmosphere,  no carpeting, nothing at all to absorb sound, it was very uncomfortable to the ear. And the food left my stomach sour all evening, perhaps it was an ingredient in the meat or something was off, but I was unsettled until the next morning.

Big fan of big, public grassy parks situated in downtowns. This one offers a view of downtown buildings and the peaceful river and is located next to museums. Nothing too exciting as far as parks go, but it is worth visiting for a stroll. I could see myself reading here. Saw a family in the middle of a photo shoot.

Really glad that events are held here, even though I wasn't able to catch any while I was in town. I hope they get a good community gathering.

Nice open area for festivals. Pretty much all the festivals have live music and food or beer of some sort and the sound is pretty good since it's not bouncing off buildings much. It does stink a little like dead fish and when the grass gets trampled it loses its looks, at least during the day. However, there's ample parking in the nearby garage, the river provides a nice backdrop, and there are plenty of restrooms. I really like the color-changing lights on the Glazer Museum...look really cool at night. If you're looking for someplace to take your kiddos to dance around to a band, all the kids I saw were having a great time dancing around to covers in the big grassy area.

I love this downtown Tampa gem of a park. Lots of events are held here and there's often live music. It's a nice sunny spot. Sono Cafe and the Tampa Museum of Art overlook it. There's also the Beer Can Building (Rivergate Tower) and the Photo Museum Cube adjacent. And the Glazer Children's Museum but they won't let me in unless I borrow someone's kids..

The landscaping of the upper part is cool. The fountains and mister rock. There's a great playground. And the dog park in the back is modern style (in keeping with the museum). There is Yoga on Sundays (5 or 6 I believe depending on season..). Bamboozle workout Wednesdays. And always great views of Tamp Bay Hotel at University of Tampa campus.

Curtis Hixon Park is an awesome centerpiece for downtown Tampa. It is located downtown, and is right on the Hillsborough River.  Across from Curtis Hixon Park is the beautiful University of Tampa.  It is an amazing view. 

Curtis Hixon Park is a focal point for many to see because of the many different views of the city of Tampa. You will also see that the Glazer Children's Museum is in walking distance as well as the Tampa Museum of Art. 

If you are looking for a place to eat, check on the Sono Café at the Tampa Museum of Art, or walk across the street, and you will find one of my favorite places Anise Global Gastrobar.

Often times, there are many festivals going on at Curtis Hixon Park. Some are pretty darn spectacular, and some are just okay. Two of the most favorite events I have been to at Curtis Hixon Park was the Burger Showdown, and the Bollywood Red Carpet Pre party for the Indian Oscar Awards. Burger Showdown was just a big huge party with tons of vendors with the best burgers in Tampa.  Picture this for the Bollywood Red Carpet Pre-Party - Imagine a Wednesday or a Thursday night with the best loudest, fun, dance music playing. It was a blast.

I also love Curtis Hixon Park because it is super pet friendly and family friendly. There is a really nice little water area for the kids to play. There is also a playground for the kids, and a dog park for your dog. 

Every time I go here, I love it more and more. It is a little bit smaller than many city parks, but just the surroundings make it great.

I can't forget, Sundays they have farmers markets here in the morning, and in the evening on Sundays, they also have Yoga. 

This is a perfect location to enjoy beautiful downtown Tampa.

This is what downtown needed. Some good open public space positioned between the arts (Tampa Museum of Art, The Florida Museum of Photographic Arts, Straz Performing Arts Center, Glazer Children's Museum), close to food (e.g., my fave L'Eden), and next to a scenic view (RiverWalk). The space also hosts some pretty neat events. Overall, this park is nice and free.

Yesterday I headed to Curtis Hixon Park for yoga in the park by Yoga Downtown Tampa. http://www.yogadowntowntampa.com/YogaDowntownTampa/HOME.html

It was fabulous! The eastern side of the park, with the tiers, is shaded by the museum in the late afternoon/early evening, and all the tiers filled up with people ready to get their yoga on by 6 p.m. Doing yoga outside with a couple hundred people was very cool (only figuratively...despite the shade, it was hot!).

The park is a great place for yoga. It was clean and well-groomed, and has public restrooms close at hand. Having the shaded museum patio was great for my group, as a place to hang out for a while before yoga. Parking in the parking deck right next door was also very convenient.

I can't wait to go back to Curtis Hixon Park for yoga again!

I really love Curtis Hixon Park. It connects to the Riverwalk overlooking the Hillsborough River. It also has a nice view of downtown Tampa and UT. It is pretty easy to get to from 275 and is surrounded by a plethora of great restaurants and hotels. 

I have been to several events at Curtis Hixon including the Margarita Festival. The park is large and has plenty of room for vendors, food trucks, a large stage and more. I do wish that there was more built in shade at the park. I know that they also have yoga in the park which would be really cool. Overall, I like this waterfront park and will return here for events.

I really love this park. Great views of the river and U of Tampa. Next to museums and yummy eating establishments and it has a lovely playground as well. We have been using this place as a great urban picnic spot on a sunny not-too-hot day.

My favorite park in Tampa! This place has regular functions, which make it a desired location for tourists and locals alike.  Looking over the water is a beautiful view of the unique architecture of The University of Tampa. 

Located in/around the park is a playground that brings the inner child out, two kid friendly water features, a small (off leash) dog park, and the river walk passes through the West end of the park. 

If you're looking for a nice place to have a picnic, wanting a beautiful walk, or taking to family out for fun day/night, Curtis Hixon Park is a good place to go.  Fun for all ages.

What a lovely attraction for the city if Tampa! It's great for any one at any age! Located right off the University if Tampa's campus it offers amazing views of the beautiful architecture the campus offers but also lies along the river walk. 

Then there are the two museums located in the park and right in the downtown area!

It seemed like a really popular spot too there were people everywhere but just sitting on the bench taking it all in was wonderful!

Great place to visit!

Nice place to lounge and enjoy the sun. I was visiting Tampa and had some time to kill one day. Decided to take a stroll and see what this park had to offer. It's a very nice addition to the hustle and bustle of a downtown city. Not much to do other than enjoy the river and the sun. I can see this place being a great yoga spot or to enjoy some kind of entertaining. 

Is it worth going out of way for if you're visiting? No. But if you're a local, this is a nice place to get away from it all.

Really nice area with lots of events going on. I went ice skating here recently and had an amazing time. Plus there are always events going on here. It's a really happening spot with great views and lots to do.

For those who know me, I am not a lover of the outdoors. It is not that I am high maintenance (although, there will be some to disagree), I just prefer the AC. Plus, I don't need a tan, I am Filipino and I was born with one. 

But....hold an event or festival at Curtis Hixon Park and I am there! I love Curtis Hixon. I do not know what it is, but every time I step into this park, there is a certain serenity that washes over me. 

The views are spectacular. Everywhere you turn, there is something to see. I love downtown Tampa because the amount of buildings is just right. The skyline is not cluttered with rows upon rows of skyscrapers. 

You can see my alma mater, University of Tampa's beautiful campus and its majestic architecture. Still after all these years, the gorgeous minarets take my breath away. At night, it is a whole new ballgame. The whole campus is lit up and is always a beautiful sight to see. 

The Hillsborough River and the Tampa Riverwalk are two more sights to see in Curtis Hixon Park. There is also the Tampa Museum of Art, Sono Cafe, and the Glazer's Children Museum nearby for you to explore. A great children's playground is located towards the river. And there is even a dog park! There is something for everyone and for all ages. 

There is plenty of parking on the streets of downtown Tampa or the Poe Garage. Most importantly, I have never felt unsafe in the garage or Curtis Hixon itself. The restrooms, in my experience are kept somewhat clean. 

There is a myriad of events held here weekly and sometimes daily. You can log into City of Tampa's website and Facebook page and take look at the calendar to find out more information about these events. And of course, you can also check out the Yelp website and click on the "Events" page and it will provide even more options for you.

If you haven't already, stop by Curtis Hixon park for a stroll, to see a beautiful sunset or sunrise, or even have a picnic. I promise, you will want to come back again and again.

Cool park on the west side of downtown, just outside the financial area.

The open area appears to be mixed-use - the day I walked past it they were setting up a giant stage and tent for an ongoing Buccaneer's event.  There were bathrooms and a concessions stand, as well as an area for kids to play.

A small, enclosed dog park with elevated pedestals for agility training or for owners to hang out on were available.  The waterfront views were nice with the exception of some areas that were run down and some graffiti was evident on bridge underpasses and tunnels.

Very nice park! It has a great location along the Tampa Riverwalk and near the Glazer Children's Museum and the Tampa Museum of Art. There are some great amenities, including two fun fountains, restrooms, drinking fountains, and a neat playground. A nice addition is a seasonal ice rink during December.

It's a great place to relax, and there are some beautiful views.

Pretty sure this is the place that has brought downtown Tampa back to life and was the foundation for the extremely popular Riverwalk which is rapidly expanding. Every weekend you will find an event that has something for everybody. Aside from some of the drinking based events, there are tons of family friendly things to do no matter what the season. Admission is sometimes free and these events normally have plenty of live entertainment. Examples of past events: Margarita Festival, Wing Fling, The Summer of Rum Festival, The Mac & Cheese Throw down, Oktoberfest, Christmas Tree Lighting, Bloody Mary Festival, Spring Fling, Rock the Park, free yoga, etc. So many things to do here. 

The park is very well kept and is so incredibly clean. I have never noticed any garbage in the grass or felt unsafe. There are public bathrooms that are really clean as well. There is also a splash park by the river and a playground for the kiddies. Dogs are almost always welcome here except for certain events. My only wish is that there were more trees and shade for those summer events that can get quite toasty. But other than that, I can not find anything to woe about. Parking can be found in the Poe garage next door that is connected to the museum (usually a fee of around $4) or you can try to find street parking nearby...this can be tricky for large events.

What a huge improvement over the previous incarnation. 

AND: Bathrooms! New, clean bathrooms! 

The terraced seating is well done, the patio that overlooks the park and river nicely designed and proportioned. There is a dog park that seems quite popular, although it seems to be where the Museum folks told me they would be expanding at some point in the future. (The museum is still way to freaking small to be useful, honestly)

The viewshed from Ashley is far improved as well. So many wins.

Now: If they'll finally restore Kiley Park with its crepe myrtles back to what its supposed to be, it will be complete.

BONUS: Read the rules for the play fountain - HILARIOUS

Very pretty park.

Came here for the bourbon, beer, bbq fest so view was limited but you could tell without the mob of people it would be a nice place to hang on a Sunday afternoon, 

The restrooms were clean and air conditioned as well. 

Nice view

Tampa's Curtis Hixon Waterfont park is the perfect place to hold community events. The event that I attended was "Take back the Night " #tbtntb or #turntampateal, an event that helps promote awareness about the resources available to those who've been victims of domestic or sexual abuse. 

There were plenty of tables but more than 1/2 of the community tables were available, they'd been assigned, but no one was at them. Wether this is because the event wasn't promoted or because those who'd committed to the tables didn't want to chance the weather (There'd been a chance of rain), it was disheartening. 

The event compromised of music, of a pledge to stop or intervene in abuse, the processional and the candelite vigil and then the stories. It was a telling and emotional evening, but a necessary one.  Given my profession, I hear a lot of stories and in my circle I am the one people come to, so now I have the resources to help my friends and chosen family.. 

You are not alone, there is help, Take back the night.

This is a great park in a great location - right on the river right in downtown!  The grounds are pretty and the events they host are all good things.

I have been for Gasparilla Music Fest, Oktoberfest, the ice skating rink, the museum and other events.

It is the best park in town, hands down!  I have yet to go to the movies on the lawn or Rock the Park and some other events.....but I will!  As a matter of fact, I'll be looking into the schedule so I can spend more time there (I believe it's the 1st Thursday of every month...).

It even hosted Chill Lounge one year.  I hope they bring it back soon!

But, one of the best events I've been to there is the Gasparilla Music Fest.  2 years in a row I went.
They host multiple stages (about 6 in all) set up in different parts of the park, even the mini amphitheater right on the water is great for an acoustic sound or a small group.  The event coordinators usually have lots of food lined up, beer trucks/vendors and a lot of local sponsors are there.

The park is open to all, the fountains shooting out from the ground along Ashley are a neat aesthetic thing kids can run and play in.

Right across from the park, over the river, sits the beautiful UT, which is great viewing, great photo backgrounds and just a pretty place.

Ahhhh, Tampa....this was a great addition to downtown!
