I probably should wait to review this place at a time that I actually go during normal business hours.  My visit was during the bewitching hour (it is a 3 am bar) and after a full day at the wineries (when I should have been home).  I'll visit again sometime and update my review...

When I was there, they had a large late night crowd (lifetime southside residents).  The decor was big open sports bar meets green walls and nice bathrooms (hey--it matters), lots of video games, high top tables (I prefer high tops for social purposes), and TV's galore,. 

For me, this is a neighborhood sports bar that is one of the nicest in this neighborhood.  But, it is not  an Irish pub, and not a place I would drive from any distance to visit.

As far as Thai food goes, I admit that I am a bit picky, bc I grew up eating some pretty fabulous Thai food. So as far as Thai Cuisine & Cafe, It was OK, but nothing to write home about. I tried the tom yom soup and the padthai with veggies. The tom yom seemed like the kind of soup you can buy at the store in a can....except they added chicken. I was pretty disappointed in the soup overall- it lacked the lemongrass flavor and spiciness and was pretty watery. My entree earned them a little redemption, but overall the tofu was shriveled and overcooked, and the noodles lacked the full flavor I am accustomed to tasting with pad thai. A bite of green curry from my friend seemed especially salty as well. 

As for the pros- they have clearly established a nice place, and the cozy decor was cute. We came with a party of 13, so it was nice of them to accommodate us in their small restaurant. The owner seemed pretty nice and eager to please. Parking is not an issue, there is a lot in the back so that is a pro.

 I dont know how recently they opened, but they have a few kinks to work out. I may try it again, but probably not for a while.

I visited this Lowe's location daily for a bit, while settling into my new home and running back n' forth for the umpteenth, millionth item that I inevitably had forgotten.  I came to dread Lowes', especially during my first visits when trying to navigate the confusing layout. You'd probably find me, zombiefied, eyes glazed over in the knobs & handles section.  

I now have come to gently accept the role of Lowe's in my life, as a new home-owner, and am semi-proficient in finding the random aisle location of oven wipes, contact paper or other weird hardware items one never expected to own.  On busy days, the check-out lines can get backed up, even with the self-checkout kiosks readily available.   I try not to enter through the garden area, as I want to immediately purchase every flower and bush in sight, take it home, where it will slowly die due to my lack of a green thumb.

It's a Lowe's.   They're pretty much the same everywhere you go.   Store is clean and they have just about everything you would ever need to build a house.

This rating is a little lower than it should be for a Lowe's because I have been let down a couple times by the staff.

First, I bought a gas grill here in September (end-of-season clearance sale) and had them hold it in the storeroom for me because I was going to be moving in November.   When I returned in November to pick up my grill, they couldn't find it and thought they might have sold it to someone else.   To compensate me for the inconvenience, they sold me another grill (also a floor model for just $100).    I specified I needed a grill that could be converted to use natural gas and the manager assured me that this model could do that and also sold me a natural gas conversion kit.

When my plumber tried to hook it up to the natural gas line, he couldn't figure out how to do it.   He called the grill manufacturer's service center and they told him that there is no way to do it with any of their grills.

I had to go back to Lowe's again and buy yet another grill.   It hasn't been delivered yet so this review may need to updated when it arrives.

Lowe's could honestly be called Amazinglyfanastic Place of Awesomeness and Do it Yourself Excitement store. I went here with my baby brother to look for torch fuel, the citronella kind. I was blown away by the green house alone! Beautiful plants and flowers were in abundance, and I felt like I was in a beautiful garden of heaven!

Everyone here was superbly helpful. The store associates know where their products are located in the store. As well as, what product would best suit your needs. Excellent for cost efficiency. 

My baby bro and I also got a great deal price matching at the check out! How cool is that for a hardware store I say check this place out. You may never want to leave!! 

Endless projects, endless possibilities...thank you Lowes!

Pretty simple review here. 
-Easy to get in and our, Glendale is never too busy and as long as you exit out the back its simple. 
-Staff is usually very helpful, sometimes they are a little understaffed and you may have to hit a call button and wait.
-Most items are in stock but on occasion you'll have to wait for a restock.
-Great customer service at the Pro Center!
-Convenient location for midtown people. its a lot better than driving way West/East/North
-Tons of Parking

Very clean store with helpful employees in the paint department. 

I would suggest not going alone as a female because the employees will not leave you alone even when they just saw their co-worker ask if you needed help & you decline. 

Valspar paint is where it's at.

I will second Kimmi M's comment on the gentleman being more than willing to tout around the store to help you out. I couldn't be more grateful for their loyal/persistant assistance. I had the dedicated service of two gentleman for nearly 20 minutes. I walked in with an evil, evil list of items I needed to purchase that, to be quite honest, I was clueless what they were. I love hardware stores, but on this particular visit I wasn't looking to lollygag and make unnecessary landscaping purchases like I typically do. Thankfully, they were willing to hold my hand from the beginning of the list to the end. 

Most often, I come to this location for the veggie plants and my unending floral "needs." Ornamental kale? You betchya! Veggie seeds? 10-4. Mini mums for your sloppy seasonal porch decor? Yessiree!

Dude. It's a Lowe's. Like every other Lowe's everywhere. They have hardware stuff and painting stuff. 

Seems a smidge classier than a Home Depot.

Staff is helpful. That's all I've got/ all I need when it comes to this sort of store.

OK, now that I can write about a Lowe's in Indianapolis, I can tell you that this place is clean and has one of the better garden centers in the inner part of Indianapolis with a very good selection of shrubs and trees. This is a store in a neighborhood of established homes and mature trees, so young trees are not in high demand and there are not good conditions for young trees unless they are replacement trees. So if you're looking for trees or shrubs, this place has a lot of them. 

The prices seem to be better here on some things than on others. The fertilizer was very expensive, but the mulch was cheaper. The sprinkler selection was especially better and cheaper than most other Lowe's, but then again, Broad Ripple and Meridian Kessler have established lawns and many of them have sprinkler systems, so it may be lack of demand. Service here is good and prompt. 

They also have a pretty good selection of products made here in the USA! That is definitely one thing I have not given Lowe's props for is their sheer number of American made goods from mom and pop manufacturers. I try my best to choose those products if I have a choice.

Ahem,
                             ^^
                           ^^^^
                          ^^^^^^
                        ^^^^^^^^
                              ||
                              ||
                              ||



Can someone please get yelp a spell checker... oh wait!  They already have one.  These mis-listings are ridiculous. Indiana(p)olis!

PS:  Sorry I've been away so long.  Life getting in the way of writing...
Love this place. Crazy busy on a beautiful sunny Sunday afternoon. So many wonderful plants to peruse through. Staff is friendly and helpful.

I thought the burger was very tasty. I got their signature Brandon Burger which was a double burger with extra bacon, extra provolone cheese, and a special Brandon sauce. The sauce was mayo based with Cajun spices, jalapeno, and ketchup (more tasty than spicy). The patties were seasoned perfectly. I detected a garlic & butter taste. I don't know if it was the seasoning on the burger or the bun. All I know is that it was juicy and full of flavor. I could only eat half of it. It was huge. I was shocked at how much bacon was on this burger. Not just a few strips. Well, you'll just have to see it for yourself. The Brandon Burger was $9.69 and well worth it. 

There are also different burger options. You can get it on a bun, in a bowl, or in a burrito. They have shakes and chicken tenders. What I liked most of all is that it's a local burger spot. They have 2 locations. Both locations occupy a space that used to be Five Guys. This particular one is on Brandon Blvd. The other location is at the Winthrop Town Center. 

I'll be back to try more burgers. The Brandon sauce was really good. I may try the chicken tenders next time, or maybe even a bowl. It was different than your ordinary burger.

I arrived on a very chilly night (which is like 61 degrees here in Florida). I ordered the Brandon burger wrapped in lettuce, some fries, and a caramel milkshake.

The allowed me to sample the caramel milkshake before committing and I truly appreciate that because there's nothing worst than buying a milkshake taking a sip and having immediate regret. 

No regret. The caramel milkshake was milk.

The burger was good. Yup, I said "good"
Not great.
Not amazing
Not "OMGGGGGG-THIS-THE-BEST-THING-EVA"

It was just good and honestly, I'm okay with good.

Additionally, I was able to have my burger wrapped in lettuce and THEY WRAPPED IT GOOD. My burger awas nd hot, fresh, and it served its purpose.

The fries were also good but I need more Brandon burger sauce because those fries + the sauce = better than good.

Service was great. The guy that took my order was friendly, attentive, and yeah... I'll be back.

The tour was ok overall.  The portions were very small and you will still be hungry afterwards.  The tastings include: gumbo, jambalaya, muffuletta and brisket po' boy.  They all were good but you are left wanting more.  

The tour guide was knowledgeable and entertaining.  I recommend purchasing your tickets with a discount through Groupon.

David was an excellent guide! He gave us so much information and we left with a much deeper knowledge of New Orleans rich history and an extensive restaurant list of places to try. Torrential rain and flash flood warnings caused us to miss the last place, but our group was perfectly happy staying at the 2nd to last place and trying alligator! Turns out, it was delicious and tasted similar to chicken. Yes, please be advised this is a sampling tour so don't come expecting a full meal. The best taste we had was definitely the gumbo at Oceana. I'd highly recommend Taste of Nawlins for anyone visiting the Crescent City.

What an excellent way to explore the top restaurants in the area! I love that you can get a taste of local favorites. It is also nice to have some history mixed in while we traveled from one location to the next. It really gave me a wonderful welcome to the city and an insider scoop!
I really enjoyed tasting gumbo for the first time and our guide was fantastic! He was funny informative & very nice. I'm grateful he made some additional recommendations for the rest of my trip and gave me directions to a music venue I have been wanting to check out on Frenchman Street. 
I highly recommend this experience! Tip: bring an umbrella to shield yourself from the rain or the sun depending on the weather.

My friend and I took this tour when we were in town and we LOVED it. We found the deal on GroupOn and were able to book it the next day. We had so much fun. Our tour guide was awesome and very friendly and knowledgeable. We were totally full at the end of the tour. I've already recommended it to a few friends and family the next time they're in the area. It was fun walking around to the different restaurants, trying the different foods and getting a bit of history of the city, as well. Totally worth it-- make sure to check it out.

First off it is amazing what they did with the space where the old bar used to be. It is bright and clean in here. Love the decor. I had read on our local town chatter site service was a bit slow but I expect bumps w new places. We came in and were seated right away. Brought chips and salsa. I was impressed w the margarita selections and asked if I could get a half strawberry half banana. No problem. She came back w free cheese dip and said the bar was backed up. 
She even upgraded my husband to a large beer. 

We ordered our dinner I had the shrimp salad my husband the chicken chimichanga. The food did take a bit to come out but when it did it was great. Hot fresh. 

The menu is your basic Mexican restaurant food. I would come back for the guac and margaritas. And the cleanliness.

Came in here with a large group of girls a few weeks ago and was very pleased, aside from a few issues. 

First let me say, the prices are amazing. Unfortunately I don't think I got a pick a of the prices, but basically you get about an 8-10 inch pizza with all the toppings of your choice, for about $9. The kids pizzas come with drinks and are about $5 give or take. The time to actually cook your pizza is magical as well. Yes, I know I said magical lol. Basically as you are paying your pizza will probably be completed. I have no idea how they do it but they do and it's really heaven. 

So my daughter had the standard cheese pizza which was good. Pepperoni was too. I had the meats option which was tasty as well. We also tried this pizza with chicken, white sauce, mozzarella, artichokes, pesto, and garlic (oh btw, get the garlic. Get lots of it. Trust me on this). This pizza was so out of the norm for my normal pizza but it was so good! 

Honestly, to me the only thing that could've been better was the customer service. There was one particular guy, I think he may have been a manager, that was just going way too fast. Like, I get that it's a fast place, but don't be so rushed while I give you my ingredients that you end up putting something on my pizza that I didn't want. Also, he seemed to have an attitude while speaking with customers. Customer service can sometimes be what makes or breaks an establishment...id hate to see this awesome pizza shop get broken by funky customer service. Thankfully everyone wasn't that way. 

Overall, id love to come back!

Easily and without a doubt my favorite food is pizza. Bury me with it. New Orleans is trying to get up in the pizza game and it's about time; we are way behind. Yes we have Pizza D and yes there's Mid City Pizza, Slice and let's not forget Theo's. However where each of those places excel in ingredients and tastiness, it's hard to find an excellent pie that is relative in price to the cost of what it takes to make each one. Blaze has that component down packed and for that, they're getting my #1 best pizza spot in Nola...for now. 

You can get a nice sized pie for under $10 with however many toppings you want in any combination. It's like the Subway of pizza but I dare not put Blaze's quality on Subway's level. Nestled in a newer, edgier sector of downtown it's got that modern touch to its interior. You can choose from their specialty pizzas or build your own. Since it was my first time I went with a specialty as I didn't want the pressure of building something I'd regret.

I went with the Meat Eater, pause. Came out super quick, the only setback I had about it was when asked if I wanted a sauce as a topping, I went with the bbq which it was good, however I don't think I would have wanted it swirled over my whole pie. I should've asked if I could get some on the side. Wasn't expecting to commit my entire pizza to that, but hey, ya live n ya learn. 

Super friendly and attentive staff, I also appreciated that the guy running the place went around and asked people if they were happy with their orders. A little bit goes a long way in hospitality with me. I'd definitely drop in here if I were you needing a downtown fix for a good pizza.

I don't know if it was a bad night or not- but the service that I received on Nov 18th 2017 at 9:20pm was absolutely horrible and I will never go back to this location again- and I recommend others not to either. Go to location on Feret. The vibe is much better and the people have a better disposition about themselves. Upon entry the guy with the glasses seemed annoyed, and was very aggressive with his answers and he seem frustrated that we didn't get what he was saying b/c he went over the menu so fast so being that I'm a fan of Blaze I took over to explain the menu better. The girls attitude were worse. They seemed very frustrated and was snickering to each other, and rolling their eyes. If it wasn't for my company I would have snapped on them. I hate bad service. Then she didn't offer me a drink or call me when my pizza was done.. she lowered her pizza peel on the floor b/c she wasn't paying attention and then cut her eye at me and still used it to take the pizzas out. New Orleans please stop hiring these socially awkward and  ghetto people to represent your businesses. It's very distasteful. Let's not add how we rushed out by the guy with the glasses omg .. horrible! Never again!

Blaze pizza has opened from California bringing the Subway concept to New Orleans. You walk in pick what crust you want and then proceed to choose what toppings you want from an abundant selection of meat and vegetable toppings. Its almost the Kramer concept from Seinfeld where you build your own pie. Once you've created your 12" masterpiece it bakes for 7 minutes and boom you have a pizza. At $7.95 you can't beat the price and they are big enough for two people. The drinks are great too as they have a blood orange lemonade that is excellent. I highly recommend this place especially if your on a budget. Only drawback is that because the ingredients are so fresh your pizza will be a little wet as 7 minutes is not enough time to burn off the condensation so the pizza is a little sloppy depending on how many ingredients you put on it.

Yummy! I finally made it over here for lunch today. There are already a bunch of pizza options in this area, but Blaze has a different concept on theirs. I'd say it's like the Chipotle of the pizza world. They serve fast and fresh quality pizzas where you can customize your order to exactly how you want it.

We came in at noon with the rest of the lunch crowd. The line was long and backed up to the door. It moved fairly quickly though. I chose the build your own pizza instead of one of their signature pizzas.

It's pretty cool. For $7.95 you get an 11" pizza and can load it up with as many toppings as you desire. First, you choose your crust - regular or gluten free (gluten free costs extra). Then you choose your sauce, cheeses, meats and veggies, etc. It is then placed in a wood fired oven for 180 seconds. They call out your name and you pick it up. We waited longer in line than the wait for the pizza was.

It was delicious. I got a small side salad to accompany it and it was also good. 

Note that the crust is very thin.. That's why it can bake so quick. But, when you add your toppings and all, it turns out well. The sauce has just the right amount of spices and flavor that culminate it all together.

I will definitely be back again!!

Not sure why all the hype for this place. 

It's Subway for pizza!  

That is all, closing keyboard now.

I am pizza... Pizza is me!!!! That being said, this place gets it all the way right. $7.95 plus tax gets you a whole pizza pie, all to yourself. The menu calls for the standard for $5 & some change; or $7.95 to build your own. 

I crafted my own with Garlic Basil as the base, ALLLLLLLLLL the cheeses in the building, add in a few jalapenos & HAPPY HAPPY AM I!!!! Then to top it off, literally and figuratively, at the end, I added oil and balsamic vinaigrette drizzle to my pizza once it edited the oven... OMG!!!! Sheesh!!! My only disappointment was that I couldn't eat it all in one setting.  

For my beverage of choice, I opted against the water, soda, coconut water, juices options... Bring on the NOLA Beer on tap. It was my first time trying it annnnnnnnnnd I was pleased. 

Start to finish, this process took about 12 minutes. That's novel for pizza making. What's the secret? Is it the massive fire oven? Or the thin, flaky, buttery crust? Or the super efficient restaurant workers? Idk, whatever the reason, it happened and that made the difference. 

The only draw back for THIS location, is the lack of parking. Truly this location caters to the CBD/downtown crowd and that's super cool. And since I know parking is the challenge I will face, I'll be prepared for it HEAD FIRST. And speaking about head first... Did I mention there's an option to call ahead??? I saw it, it happens and then so now BLAZE has been added to my list of places for one of my infamous #stickandmovecapers!!!! Great, Great, Great!!!!

The gluten free pizza is great! The first time in the factory ensemble line is a little awkward but it moves quickly, respectful and wonderful nice at being able to pick all your ingredients without being overly charged. 

You pick the toppings, sauce and cheese then pay. They bake it and deliver it to your table. 

Glad we found this place so close to the hotel!!

Summary:

-11" pizza = $7+tax
-build your own
-great variety of toppings but also sauces and cheeses! AND they let you do HALF/HALF!!
-line moves quick
-friendly staff

I honestly could not have been more pleased... I am that person that ALWAYS wants to make substitutions.  Build your own is my best friend.  Build your own AND you can do half/half..even half/half sauce?? ...AND its the same price?! Dreams do come true. The only thing I could suggest would be to have the ingredients listed on the board as well, it would help to build a pizza, without knowing what else is down the line it makes it a little difficult. I ofcourse went online to look at the menu first! 

I meant to take a photo but ate it too quickly. 

11" is more than enough. I had leftovers, if I got a side salad I would have had 2 perfect meals.

There are tons of toppings. Almost everything you could ask for.  The toppings are quality ingredients.

Here's my creation to give you an idea.

No sauce. I'd prefer pesto drizzle but thats at the very end and I can't hold up the line. 

1/2
Ricotta - love that they have that! 
Chicken
Spinach
Mushrooms
Artichokes
Pesto drizzle

1/2
Shredded mozzarella + parmesean
Chicken
Bacon
Pineapple
Green peppers
Jalapeno
BBQ drizzle

Blaze in general is the Chipotle of pizza. It's a bountiful buffet of toppings, waiting to be added to your weird or wonderful creation. The standard crust leaves something to be desired, but it's not terrible. Just neutral.

This location of Blaze seems to be a cheap, easy place for rising 20-somes to grab dinner in the CBD, just steps from their luxury apartment without admitting that they are eating what is basically fast food. The pounding generic rock drowns out the desperation of a disaffected youth growing older and more cracked as the seconds pass. It also drowns out any hope of polite conversation, pushing every exchange into the register of shouts and howls. I don't love it.

The other down-vote I have for this location is that everyone who works here seems miserable. There's no amount of commanding from on high that can make under-paid, over-worked, poorly-managed employees into a happy chorus of Disney-esque dancers that are ready to dazzle and delight just for their own pleasure. I suspect the fault is in management, but really, who am I to be an armchair quarterback about the dehumanization of an entire staff? Yes, exactly. So if you can ignore the whiff of despondency that pervades the staff, Blaze is fine.

It's just fine. 

Accessibility notes: doors open out. Medium counter with high sneeze guard. Loud music. Lights can be dim. No Braille menu or signage. Drink fountain is high for seated guests.

Running all over town on business and we need a snack. 
Blaze pizza to the rescue!
Staff immediately greets you with big smiles. 
Call out your dough. We chose high rise.
Then sauce, cheeses (add extra cheeses for flavor!)
Our toppings were simple this time.  
Grab a seat, and so fast out the oven.
My son and I bonded over a quick hot snack.  
It was blazing with every bite and I'd forgotten what a fun experience this is.  

Special Yelp check in offer at this location, which I had to save because I checked in way late after we sat down (all the better to check in right away to take advantage of yelp perks) and we were pressed for time.

I bet this place can get packed, but there were lots of seats and this city is known for sharing and caring.  Come say hello and sit down! I'll share my table with y'all anytime!

I'll be the first to admit that I am not a huge fan of the "wood fired" pizza trend that seems to be sweeping the city. What I usually get is pizza with crust that is cooked to different consistencies and that just doesn't do it for me.

This place is basically a Chipotle for pizza. You get in line, tell the people making your pizza what you want, they throw it in the oven and it's cooked in about 3 minutes.

I stopped in for lunch and it was a weekend, so the line was pretty long. I got in line and after deciding on the "meat eater", I ordered, added a few extras (veggies) and, as promised, it cooked quickly.

Here's my complaint: the crust (what they call their regular crust, not thin crust) is really thin. It's almost too thin and if you have too much "stuff" on your pizza, it's not going to stay on there. My other complaint is that the crust just lacks flavor to me. It's pre-made, so I don't know if it comes from a package, but it just doesn't have any kick to it. Finally, what makes pizza good (in my opinion) is when it gets a chance to bake and all of the ingredients get a chance to cook into the crust and kind of meld together. That doesn't happen when a pizza is cooked in only 3 minutes.

A lot of people seem to dig this place but it just isn't my style and I will stick to some other pizza places around town.

No. I didn't like it.

Ingredients - ok, you can put a lot of stuff on your thin crust pizza for the same price as if you put nothing. I get it. But they aren't quality ingredients! The sauce wasn't anything worth eating, and the crust certainly didn't taste like anything special.

Price - I understand if this is a good price if you're looking for a quick meal when you're working downtown, but honestly Rouse's pizza is better. Probably faster and cheaper, too.

Staff - This is how I like my pizza - ALL MY PIZZA: heavy on the sauce and light on the cheese. The little girl who was helping me looked at me like I was insane when I cheerily asked for "more sauce, please" with a stupid smile on my face.  When I could still see that nasty thin crust showing through the sauce I further commented, "I don't want to be able to see the dough through the sauce." Nasty facial expression received!! I already had a bad taste in my mouth before ever taking a bite of anything.

Venue - Noisy. There was only one other table of people in there. 'Nuff said.

When it came down to eating the pizza, it wasn't the worst pizza I ever had and it certainly was far from the best. I'd rather not eat here again, but it isn't on my "never go back" list.

Have you ever wished you could tell a pizza place EXACTLY how to make your pizza??  "I wanted more sauce..."  "I want more pepperoni and less peppers..."
Well, Blaze is the place for you!!
Every pizza is an 11-inch thin crust (the only drawback, in my opinion).  And I highly recommend the "Build Your Own" option.  You go through a line just as if you were at Subway or Chipotle, and you tell them exactly what you want and how much you want.  and it's $8, period.  No catch.  As many different toppings as you want, as much of each as you want.  And the staff are trained to greet you very enthusiastically, which was a little shocking at first, but fun.
My first trip I got spicy red sauce, mozzarella and feta cheeses, italian sausage, pepperoni, spinach, cherry tomatoes, and fresh basil.
My second trip I split with my SO, and we got regular red sauce (extra extra extra sauce), mozzarella (light light light on the cheese), pepperoni, and italian meatballs.
When your pizza is ready they stick it in the oven for 180 seconds.  Then they take it out, yell your name, and cut it.  There you go.  
I guess they are all thin crust so they all cook in 3 minutes.  But I'd wait a little longer for hand-tossed if that were an option.

I really dig this place!  For $6-$8 you can get a ready made pizza with the toppings of your choice in less than 5 minutes.  I really don't have any complaints.  This is like the Subway of pizza joints.  You show up, pick your toppings, and BAM, 3 minutes later you have a fresh pizza.  

I was a little hesitant about the taste, but the pizza really delivered.  There are lots of toppings to choose from.  They also serve beer.  Win, win.  We will be back for sure.

Since we had the Yelp event here, i think have eaten at least five Blaze pizzas. I order the same thing everytime because I am boring (red sauce, ricotta, mozz, roasted garlic) but everytime it is insanely good. 

The za comes out in like 4 minutes and it is awesome.

The restaurant has a great friendly vibe and I would recommend this place to anyone that likes pizza.

Plus...they deliver!

I was turned on to this business while visiting family in Florida.  I couldn't tell you how excited I was when I found out that there was one in Louisiana. (although I would be even more excited if there was one in Baton Rouge)  The business is pizza based on a subway (or izzos) concept.  You pick out your dough (regular or gluten free), choose your sauce, cheeses, meats, veggies, and seasonings.  To build your own pizza, unlimited toppings generally speaking, is $7.95.  If you just want a one topping pizza it is $6.95 and a cheese pizza is $5.  All the pizzas are 11 inches, so it is big enough to share if you just want a little bit or small enough to eat by yourself if you are hungry.  They also offer a few salad options, but we did not explore those since we were in the mood for pizza.  

Once you add all your toppings they bring it over to this open faced, wood burning, oven and cook your pizza for a couple of minutes.  You can ask them to cook it longer, but with the thin crust it pretty much comes out perfect unless you add a bunch of toppings.  Then you should have it cooked a couple of mins more so that the crust isn't soggy.

Overall flavor is awesome!  I like to get the spicy red sauce on my pizza and then cover it with the meats.   It has a kick to it that keeps your nose running, but man is it so good!  The staff is pretty awesome too, there were about 7 people working the counter when we visited, at about 7pm, and they were all very cheerful and happy to help and explain how the concept worked.

A+

4/5 quick, customizable, and filling for the price.

though it doesn't quite deliver on the 3 minute thing, i'd say it's a swift line and a swift bake. you best believe i'm trying to top that pizza so much that it folds under its own weight. green stripe, prime with a red sauce base, add mushrooms + kalamata olives. for a pizza that is really 2 smalls, the $9ish dollar price tag is quite good. 

so is it on the golden crust list? nah. i mean it's meant to be the quick option, the thing you swing by for on the way home (or in my case what you pick up when you need to go back to the office for more work). but i like that it offers you a bunch of different options - i mean i don't know the math but the different ways you can top that must be great. 

i'd say this place is good if you're a parent who has a child (or an adult with child-like habits) who is a picky eater - this lets you pack on veggies and limited meat, go all meat, etc. and unlike other spots, your customization won't cost you much more.

the staff are pretty friendly. i don't know if i'm coming in too frequently but they've started to remember me...it's okay, my waist will always be memorable!

This was my first Blaze pizza experience and it wasn't great.  This was partially my fault for thinking I could build a better pizza than their suggestions on the menu board but my pizza also didn't seem to be cooked as well as everyone else sitting around me.

First things first, this location is very popular.  There was a long line to order so you know they are doing something right.  I also visited on the evening of the Bruno Mars concert, so this was also why there was a delay.  No big deal ... it wasn't too bad of a wait even with the crowd.  Its also in a nice location next to a few other restaurants and within walking distance of everything downtown.

As for the pizza itself, I was there with three others who each ordered from the suggested menu.  They all had really good pizzas.  The flavors mixed well and they were cooked through.  I built my own pizza with mozzarella cheese, classic sauce, ham, garlic, green peppers and spinach.  I thought that sounded good and then my friend brought it to the table when our order was ready.  Out of the four pizzas, mine did not look cooked as much as theirs did.  It just wasn't good.  I would have asked for it to be cooked again or ordered something else but we ran out of time with the initial wait and we were headed to Bruno ... who is much more important than pizza.

So, I'll give another Blaze another try ... next time ordered a pre-arranged flavor suggestion since my creation wasn't worth two bites.  Here's to the next time for pizza and Bruno Mars!!

A BETTER MOUSETRAP 
I don't know how this intuitively dummy-proof "pizzasubwayaria" could be any more efficient.

LOGICAL LAGNIAPPE (see my pics)
- they can divide sauces & toppings gratis on any of these 10" pizzas
- splittable: a whole pie ($7.99) & cold drink after tax & tip is about $12
- The 7-8 minute cook time is enough to grab a table, drink & flatware
- fountain refills are free, including lemonade and sweet tea
- go-boxes, condiments, cutlery, napkins are all self serve
- seats 75, free wifi, and it's counter serve so tip is negligible
- they even have a build your own online nutrition calculator.

CAVEAT: it's super thin crust so it can get soggy with too many toppings.

PROTIP: so ask them to cook it a little longer, and cut it into easier to handle 1/8ths not 1/6ths.

Pretty good gluten free pizza.  The crust is just a smidge too thin, but that's just me quibbling.  

Definitely order online 45 minutes ahead during lunch.  The service was friendly and it's a pretty good value.  Love that toppings don't cost extra.

Good service, but you can tell that the staff are still working out a few kinks.

Love me some Blaze!!

I enjoy being able to see all of the available ingredients to customize my pizza while I'm making those ever important decisions.  Fresh mozzarella, ricotta, parm? Pepperoni, mushrooms, olives, Brussels sprouts? Yep, Brussels sprouts!! And they were delicious!

The concept isn't brand new when you're talking sandwiches, but it's new to me when it comes to pizza.  From the crust, to the sauce, to the toppings - you can see how fresh the ingredients are. When you're done putting your pie together it's fun to watch it go into the big oven.  The whole process is a quick one, and before you know it your pizza is done. 

The staff seems to be happy to be at work which always adds some sunshine to my meals. Several of the employees made sure we were all good during our visit. 

When I checked in on my yelp app there was a free dough garlic knots offer. They were delicious!! Make sure you check in and give these nuggets a try.

I didn't know what to expect because I refused to read reviews first before going. I did although see the assembly line style toppings bar while walking past one day. My curiosity grew trying to guess which toppings they offered.

I walked in and learned once it was my turn that not only do they offer gluten free crust,but they also offer a way for me to make my pizza gluten and not having to forgo the cheese. This in itself was a huge win for me. Not many can offer both. After I chose my crust I moved down the ling to the toppings. They have enough options to satisfy any palate. When it came to sauce I chose the classic red and I thought it was very good. I consider their meat and cheese selection impressive for a very inexpensive pizza place. I added mushrooms, spinach, artichoke hearts, black olives, bell peppers, and pineapples to my pie. I would've liked to see more veggie options so next time I could create a totally new pizza. Next time I'll do less toppings or plan ahead so I won't run out of options and get bored with it. 

My crust was cooked perfectly which is also something that is hard to accomplish. The toppings all had a chance to do their thing in the fire bricked oven. I think it only took about 4 or 5 minutes. Gluten free crusts take a little longer. I was worried about the beer selection since I hadn't had any of those they offered. I did appreciate them all being local brews. I chose "Southern Drawl" from a brewery in Shreveport named the Great Raft. I really enjoyed it. They offer wines also. I will return soon to make another creation of my own.

For fast food this is 5*! Weeknights in the CBD this place is quiet and it's fast for anytime, even when you're off to the Superdome to see The Rolling Stones! Flatbread pizzas to order, $7.99, what's to complain about! They are wood-fired and crispy if you want, tasty and with a zillion options, including pesto and a spicy marinara as well as at least 4 kinds of cheese!  It's the bomb! With a little beer and soft drinks and interesting iced teas and juices, it's a great place for family and friends! Bon appetit!

Boo! We loved it in Florida. Wanted to try in New Orleans. The crust sucked! They burnt the pizza edges. I had to ask multiple times to keep adding toppings. At first only 5 pieces of pepperoni I had to tell them 3 times to the point I was laughing asking them to add more. We paid for the unlimited toppings. Hello....pile it on. Every single time I had to say can you put more of everything. I thought they server would get the hint. But nope! My side salad sucked. Not one piece of goat cheese! What a fail.

There's a new pizza place in town, and well, they're kind of the hottest thing right now.  Located in one of the newest buildings in downtown New Orleans, this place boasts a speedy assembly line, fresh dough made from scratch, and a blazing hot oven that fires their pizzas in just 180 seconds.  Think Chipotle, but with pizza.

The newness of this place bring a large line during lunch, and understandably so since their prices are very reasonable (7.95 for a signature), especially for its location.  Although this can be shared between two people, I have to admit to consuming the whole pizza by myself...

Blaze offers signature pizzas, but also offer the option to customize your own pizza.  They offer gluten-free dough, and their cheeses are all pasteurized.  I was torn between the BBQ Chicken and the Green Stripe, which is is a pizza with pesto drizzle over grilled chicken, roasted red peppers, chopped garlic, mozzarella, arugula, and settled for the latter.  I also chose to add garlic to mine (in picture below) from the huge variety of toppings, which made it that much better. 

Even though the line was nearly out the door, because the pizzas are thin crust, they are quick (just 180 seconds in the oven!).  Thin crust pizza is my favorite, and they do it just right without burning the crust.  Another point I noticed was that the ingredients they use look fresh (especially their cheeses), and their workplace is clean.  Unfortunately, I can't say this about the majority of restaurants in New Orleans, and I appreciate it that much more when I find a place that is casual, comfortable, and clean.  Needless to say, I will probably be returning when I'm craving pizza.  And maybe just so I can try the s'more pies. Mmm...
Went here with the family before the Saints game yesterday.  Everyone was so nice, great prices, and the pizza was great.  Will be back!!

Blaze was represented at the NOLA Yelp Krewe de Vieuxing party on 1/23/16 and I was lucky enough to get a coupon...once the parade was over the children wanted to try it out because of the coupon...I was game so we headed on over...

Walked in and they had a number of patrons but we were able to order immediately...went with a Meat Lover's and another that was half White Top and half pepperoni and black olive...

After placing the order the pizzas came out PDQ (pretty damn quick)...I'm personally a huge fan of thin crust and found these pizza crusts to be very good...

My drawback with this place is the fact that they are real light on the toppings...The daughter loved her White Top and I tried a bite and have to tell you that was a very tasty pizza and I'm in no way a fan of white pizza...the son liked his but wasn't blown away and I agree with the son's assessment...

However it did the job for a reasonable price and I'd recommend the place to anybody craving pizza and wanting a quick sit down meal...

This place is nothing short of fun! It's like a nicer more updated version of subway pizza style. You can top your pizza with almost anything here! They have fresh ingredients and everything done is made and fire cooked right in front of you. They have a few outdoor patio seats with umbrellas and they have a buffet style ordering arrangement, so you walk in, pick up a menu, and go up to the line and order your pizza there. 

With fresh toppings and an almost endless combinations, they really allow you to personalize your pizza. Great for kids, as they can pick their own toppings and watch the pizza being made. 

Friendly staff, updated clean inside. The only reason it's not getting a full 5 stars is because the table we sat at was dirty. But other than that, the staff was awesome, the food came up fast and fresh and the kids had fun watching their own personal pizza get built!! 

And of course the food was amazing. The pizzas are good for sharing, we got one for the kids to split and two for us, we ended up splitting them all and it wasn't super expensive. Our family of 4 ate for $21!!!! Not a bad day considering we usually spend more than $50 as a family!!! Affordable. Friendly staff. Kid friendly. Hip. Clean. Delicious. Convenient and fast. Definitely will be eating here again!!!

Can't beat the prices on the pizzas here. $7.95 for signature pizzas or for any toppings. I wouldn't add too much toppings to the pizza because the crust is fairly thin. We had the BBQ chicken and it was delicious (can add more toppings with no additional cost). They have a wide variety of toppings that I am willing to come back and try!!

 Staff was quiet and didn't seem to talk much. They were quick and efficient with the pizza. Pizza cook time 180 seconds!! Once the pizza is done, they will call your name to pick it up. You can grab your own drinks and condiments. The restaurant was clean as well as their working station which is a plus.

I did not hesitate when selecting five stars because I truly enjoyed my first time experience at Blaze today. Where do I start? If you are not familiar - it is a "chipotle-style" quick serve pizza spot. We were warmly greeted and asked if this was our first time. The employee proceeded to share how it works. We went down the assembly line and made our selections - fresh! Fresh! Fresh ingredients! I selected the build your own and chose a variety of meats, veggies and cheeses. By the time I made my drink at the fountain and found a seat - they were calling my name. Wow - so fast. Thin crust, perfect sauce and great toppings. The yummy pizza, coupled with the excellent service makes this spot a winner. Now, all we need is a location in Baton Rouge. I'm sold!

Really good pizza, we ended up sharing three giant pies among eight people. They pack on the toppings, especially for meat lovers pizza which is my favorite! Chicken barbecue and cheese pizza are a close second, but my favorite one has got to be The meat lovers with ham, sausage, pepperoni, chicken, onions and a bunch of other yummy goodies.

BLAZE AND COMPANY BURGER ARE BUSTLING
I hadn't had lunch at Blaze in about a year and was curious as to it's staying power in this de novo neighborhood. Blaze and Company Burger were quite busy around noon on a Monday with about 3/4 or more of their seating occupied.

WILLA JEAN & MAGASIN KITCHEN WERE QUIET
After getting take-out at Blaze I stuck my head into these two restaurants and they had maybe 1/4 of their seats taken. It's no surprise to me, while Blaze offers an affordable quick lunch alternative, both Willa Jean and Magasin are over-priced for uneven quality. Maybe they depend on dinner business.

NEW RESTAURANTS ARE COMING!
It will be interesting to see how this experiment shakes out.

Not much I can say that hasn't already been said, and I've been to one in Maryland so I knew what to expect.  Blaze, the brainchild of 2nd rate pretzel slinger Wetzels Pretzels, makes a surprisingly delicious thin crust pizza.  I love that they give you the option to customize everything, including the sauce and cheese selections.  It would be cool if they had a seafood option like &Pizza in the DC area, but still great.  They also have awesome lemonade with free refills.  

This particular Blaze also serves beer and wine and tries to incorporate Louisiana into their menu.  When I went a couple days after they opened, they had alligator on the line, which was awesome!

It's in the soon-to-be-awesome South Market District.  Parking is easy right now but don't expect it to stay that way.

Okay so my first time here wasnt so great but I will give it another try because my friend said its a great place to eat. I came here with my boyfriend on a Wednesday and the WHOLE reason we came was to get the Steak Sammy we asked our waitress if that was on the menu and she said NO, I will give her the benefit .. she was new and did not know the specials. I asked her twice thought about the specials and she said there was only a drink special. She did suggest an awesome sandwich so that is why I am giving it a 3 star rating rather that a 4 or 5 star. My boyfriend loved his burger and we loved the pickles and the dipping sauce. We will be back, and hopefully will get the steak sammy. I did talk to the manager and he apologized and he said next time it wont happen and to make sure I see him next time I come in and he would make arrangements. That is great customer service and that is why I will be back and get the steak sammy everyone has been talking about LOL
So my second time here and omg that was a big difference!! Steak sammy was awesome !! Service was awesome as well!! Bringing everyone next time!!

What a super cool little ice cream parlor! It also doubles as a vintage toy and candy store. There's so much cool stuff to look at and buy! 

They had all kinds of candy from my childhood, including wax "coke" bottles with sugary liquid inside. Lots of small portions of things too, so you can easily collect a wide assortment of your favorites to enjoy. 

If you're vacationing nearby with kids and want the family fun to continue in your condo at night, you should definitely stop in and shop from their wall of "vintage" games. They have everything from card games, water puzzle games, to board games and the first electronic type toys. They even have full sized peddle cars! 

I've had my limit of lactose for the week, but my son got a double scoop of Cookies & Cream and gobbled it right down. I did take a taste, and it was quite delicious. I got a couple small boxes of our favorite candy, and my total was under $5. 

We enjoyed the cool bar they have in the middle for you to enjoy your cold treats. It's  covered in soda bottle caps, and then graced with napkins and vintage games for you to tinker with. 

The woman who took care of us was an extremely sweet and friendly gal. Very welcoming and warm. We will definitely be back when our sweet teefs need satisfied again!

This new park is gorgeous. We spent the day there yesterday for The Riverfront Rock Fest and I am not even sure if we saw everything it has to offer. 

There is a huge soccer field, basketball courts, tennis courts, A huge water park / splash area for the kids, outdoor ping pong tables, some sort of combination of bowling and pool (I am not familiar with this game) and more. 

The concert area was pretty nice. It had a huge area with thick grass that was nice enough (at least for now) to sit on without a blanket. There are two huge sail looking canopies to give you a reprieve from the shade. The stage includes large screens on each side. We saw Third Eye Blind and it was pretty awesome! There are also stairs to sit on farther back. 

The park is located on the river and is gorgeous once you are inside. The neighborhood on the outside is maybe not the best. There is also not really anywhere to park, so I am not sure how that will work out for future events. We parked in a slightly precarious place yesterday. 

Overall, it is a really cool park. I hope that it stays as nice as it is now. I would definitely like to return.

I was so happy when they finally finished re-constructing this park. This park has been a part of the downtown scene for many years. However, this has undergone a major renovation which was finished earlier this year. Now it's completely redone with new outdoor furniture, event stage, loading docks, City of Tampa owned multi-use/community building, picnic tables, barbecue grill, wide open lawn areas, playground for the kids, water mist zone, bike rack with a few rental bikes, etc. This is also another water taxi stop. 

Its multi-level terrain provides for a very scenic view from every angle of this park. I see a lot of potential for many different types of events in this area. I was thoroughly impressed by the redesign of this park. It was worth the visit.

I love what they did with this park! My favorite part is the green space. So much grass for my dog Mocha Coconut. There's a great park for the kids and splash zone for them too. It's free so perfect for these grueling summer hot days. When you walk around the trail there's a cool electronic game where u and your friends can run and hit the lights. I don't give much description but when you run into it, you will know what I'm talking about.

There are nice views of the river and the Straz here. There's much more to the park than I was able to see so I will definitely be back!

I heart this new, awesome, gentrified yet still hip free park that is the pride of Tampa Bay. I seriously feel rich just coming here any time. I have done free outdoor yoga here on Sundays and taken my kid silliness out on the playground. I love how expansive and spacious this park is with awesome amenities like clean restrooms, water playground for kids and non-watered playground too.

This unique, super long slide has me coming back again.  I haven't been able to find anything else like it in the Bay Area.  It's a huge metal slide on the side of a giant hill.  Well, I say giant, but I don't want to embellish it too much.  The hill is only about 20 feet tall, and the slide is only about 50 feet long.  Something about it is just super fun though.  To enhance the excitement and maximize speed, some kids put sand on the slide and sit on cardboard.  This is equivalent to putting non caloric silicon base kitchen lubricant 500 times more slippery then any cooking oil on a saucer sled.

Pros:  Unique park with lots of playgrounds and available activities.  Plenty of wide open grassy areas for passing the football or Frisbee, and lots of shady areas to lounge out comfortably in peace.  Tons of benches/places to sit.

Cons:  Parking is limited.  I'm not too sure about the neighborhood. Its not a park I would venture at night.   Even in the datetime, I don't like parking or I can't see my car.  Maybe I'm just paranoid.

It's fun, and I keep coming back!  I recommend it, just don't leave any valuables in your car.

Julian B Lane Riverfront Park is located in Downtown Tampa, off North Blvd, just North of University of Tampa and Tampa Preparatory High School, across from the hood on the west side, and across from the Hillsborough River, the Straz Center for Performing Arts, and within eye-shot of the other Downtown Tampa waterfront park, Curtis Hixon Park on the east. Julian B Lane Riverfront Park has undergone a massive multi million dollar renovation and the results are amazing! I applaud the mayor and the city of Tampa for doing a great job with this park. I've had the pleasure of attending the Navy Band performance on the park's opening weekend and the Stella Artois event at the River center with beautiful views of the city! I love that there is plenty of free parking at this facility which is sorely missing from the Curtis Hixon Park. This park Is now a great spot to play tennis, do water sports, or a good starting point to get onto the Tampa Riverwalk. I look forward to coming here for many more special events, concerts, tennis, and Water sports! 

Julian B Lane Riverfront Park features: 
- River Center for indoor special events 
- Boat House with rowing boats, kayaks, and stand up paddle boards 
- Play Cove splash pad area for kids 2-12 
- Festvial Lawn for concerts 
- 2 dog parks for large and small dogs 
- boat docks for kayaks, water taxi, and boats 
- Bat house 
- 6 concrete tennis courts
- 2 pickle ball courts
- basketball courts
- 1 multipurpose sports field for football & soccer 
- 5 standard size shelters
- 1 large corporate/event shelter
- 1 Neos Playground system
- 2 ping pong tables
- 2 chess / checkers tables 
- Standup Paddleboard & Kayak Rentals

Beautiful new addition to downtown Tampa and Riverwalk area. Finally, a change from the eyesore, construction scenery from the other side of the river. With additional parking lots and public restrooms, plus dog park, basketball courts, and ping pong tables, this park has a little something for everyone. 

It wouldn't be the Tampa Riverwalk without works of art lining the perimeter. Expect to find optical treats in unsuspecting nooks while exploring the park. 

The River Center seems to be the after school hotspot for young rowers to practice. The inside is industrial looking with hardwood and exposed supports throughout. Amazing views of downtown from the huge glass windows. Suitable for weddings and private events. When lit up at night it enhances the cityscape along the water.

Conveniently next to the bridge on W Laurel, making crossing the river easy on foot. Adjacent to an area on the verge of gentrification. Close to Armature works and the Boys and Girls Club, and about an hour walk from Sparkman Wharf. 

I highly recommend crossing the river and checking out the Julian B Lane Riverfront Park. Parking is limited so I would recommend having a backup plan  just in case!

The City of Tampa put a huge amount of money into this park and it's turned out very well. The fields back out onto the river, offering a nice open view of the boats going by and some of Tampa's interesting architecture decisions downtown. 

There are excellent tennis courts, some pickle ball courts (that we wish were more tennis courts), a really nice splash pad for kids, a great playground, a beautiful avenue of mature trees with a raised walkway, and lots of space to set up festivals, food trucks, etc.

There is also a genuinely lovely boathouse at one end, feeding out onto the river.

Located in Downtown Tampa, this park is wonderful!  Thank  you City of Tampa for the investment that was put in for this park! The events held here are amazing and the view is great! Very family friendly and there is so much to do here.  A great playground for your little ones as well!

What an outstanding place to enjoy the outdoors. This lovely waterfront park is simply full of art, activities, not one, but two, areas devoted to dogs, plenty of picnic shelters and even a few exercise stations.

The location is perfect for a stroll on its side of the Hillsborough River or as part of an extended excursion along the Riverwalk. It would also be an ideal outing to take the family for a day or simply to just to hang out, relax, enjoy the scenic surroundings and watch all the ways people play in and around the water.

Parking was plentiful on a weekend visit when there were lots of people. There are bikes on-site to rent so it would be a convenient place to park, and then rent a bike to ride around the downtown area, out to the two new food halls near Ulele or to explore the whole of the Riverwalk.

We enjoyed hiking the entire perimeter of the park and a little bit beyond. There are historical markers placed throughout that give context to the area, its past and how the neighborhood has changed over the decades.

Water fountains and restrooms are available and conveniently located near the children's playground area and splash pad.

We were there during daytime but there seemed to be lots of lights placed throughout the park. I can imagine it must be beautiful at night.

Hoping to enjoy events at this lovely site and making future visits to further celebrate this wonderful addition to Tampa's public spaces!

What a great addition to Tampa!

We weren't able to make it to the Riverfront Rock festival this weekend, but wanted to check out the new park so we went early in the morning to check it out.  Honestly, the only reason that I didn't give it 5 stars is due to the parking situation.  The parking lot was closed off due to there being an event later that day so we had to park in the neighborhood.  I get that they purposely limited parking to get people to take public transportation, but that is really hard for people with small children in car seats so it was a bit inconvenient.  I digress...

Outside of the parking, this park is AWESOME.  First of all, it is huge!  There were tons of areas to hang out and relax.  Second of all, the kids area was awesome.  My almost 2 year old LOVED the playground and was eyeing the splash area too.  There were also a lot of adult fun options too like bocce ball, corn hole, chess, checkers, etc.

The park is also beautiful.  It is right on the water with a view of downtown and the landscaping was great.  There is a boat house that also hosts an event space on the top floor, which I think will get a lot of traffic.

I expect to see a lot of the events that were previously held at Curtis Hixon getting moved to Riverfront Park.  I know I will be there often!

This new park is so cool. I love that it is so big and that there is the huge green for you to lay out on but then it also has tennis courts, tables for eating and hanging out and great facilities (water, bathrooms). It even has a little water area for kids.

Super cool park that is a great addition to the area.

I came for the opening weekend to check it out. First of all, I had no idea that this park even existed, shout out to Nicole G. for the insider knowledge. I'm pretty sure if I lived closer I would have been jonesing for this park to be finished, but I just got to reap the rewards.

The city paid major moola for this park and it shows. Everything is new and shiny. Definitely check it out now while it is still the place to be! I have a feeling that since they spent so much money on this park they will continue the upkeep.

There is a great play area for kids. They have a water zone, which is perfect for the summer. 

The amphitheater is also pretty nice. I can see this being a Curtis Hixon Park type place where there will be tons to do. Also the proximity to the water taxi makes it easy for you to make a day out of going up and down the river to the various attractions.

Perfect park for our four legged friends. They have water fountains for the dogs to drink from and for them to play in. There is a small dog and a big dog section. 
What a great space the city put together and it's free! Love it!

Whether for the kids or yourself. This park is absolutely beautiful!  I'm a nanny and took my 1 yr old darling here. They have fenced in playgrounds for appropriate ages and an amazing water pad.  However I saw many adults jogging and holding exercise classes in here as well.  Was clean and felt safe with plenty of parking spots.  Take the family here for some free fun!!

We live down the street from this park and there was a huge investment into remodeling it several years ago. Prior to the remodel it was a dumpy looking space that wasn't open and had wooded trails, tore up tennis courts and beat up fields. Now it's a large open field with pavilions, sidewalks, basketball courts, tennis courts,pickle ball, dogs parks, splash pad with a large playground. I love coming here daily for a run to connect to the river walk, rollerblading, bringing the fur baby, taking the kids for a play date or just watching the sunset over the river. This park shows the best of tampa. Sometimes you'll even catch manatees coming up for air and dolphins.  

During the fall the park is host to many events, concerts and even firework displays. Perfect meeting point for the community.

They city did a wonderful job remodeling  this park. We would come here and although this was a beautiful pArk. No one really came to enjoy it much. It was always empty. I was scared to let me kids run in the sand where all the playground set were. Who know me how much cat doo , broken glass or whatever can lurk in dirt. But now the park is open, shaded and there is so much to do. Large open field for large events. Splash pad for the kiddos, tennis courts, soccer field,convention center, docks and plenty of seating. I love how the city is connecting to our river and brining the parks and downtown to life.

We attended The Riverfront Rock Fest yesterday evening. 
This festival was for the grand opening of Julian B. Lane Riverfront Park.  

The park is going to be a wonderful addition to the up and coming Heights District of Tampa.  The park has a boathouse with docks and paddle boards, tennis courts pickle ball counts, an event lawn, an area for food trucks and so much more. 

Yesterday's free opening event featured, fitness classes, tennis and pickle ball clinics, the annual Mac and cheese competition, Navy sky divers, food trucks, beer/wine for purchase and music all day with Third Eye Blind headlining!  The event was free to attend.  The Mayor Bob Buckhorn also did the ribbon cutting ceremony.  

Who does not love free concerts in the park!

Wow, I cannot believe it took me so long to visit Julian B. Lane Riverfront Park! (Thank you Tina S. for the play date invite!) This is now my favorite park in Tampa!

As the name suggests, this park is located on the Hillsborough River, just up the street from the University of Tampa. The park offers something for everyone! There are tennis courts, pickle ball courts, basketball courts, an astroturf field for sports, two playgrounds, a splash pad, two dog parks, covered picnic areas, an event pavilion and docks for boats and kayaks. Not to mention those water views!

I really like how the playground has an area for smaller children, but it is pretty common to find an older child roughhousing on the equipment. The one thing that the park is lacking is swings which is a shame because that is my son's favorite. The playground was definitely designed with Tampa's weather in mind and offers lots of shady areas. Once the afternoon heat gets unbearable you can cool off on the splash pad. Of all the wonderful amenities the parking lot is my favorite! There is plenty of parking and I can always find a spot!

I've always seen pictures of this park and wondered where it was. It's on the opposite side of Armature Works. It is absolutely beautiful. What an amazing job they did redoing the whole thing and turning it into such a wonderful place to hang out with the kids and the furbabies! Lots of space to roam and play! There's a playground and a basketball court. 

The inside of the River Center is a great spot to have an event! It's a pretty big space inside to have a wedding reception with a great view of the river. They store all the dragonboats and crew stuff at this location as well. Lots to do here so make sure you make time for a whole day of being outside in the beautiful Tampa sunshine!

Why 5 stars? Because what else could you want in a park?

   ---   ---   ---

As the parent's of a one-year old, we're constantly on the hunt for places to keep him entertained on the weekend. He's made it abundantly clear that he's seen it all and done it all when it comes to things within our house, and that he's ready to explore Tampa Bay. 

And since my wife and I started dating, our favorite thing to do was explore the city for new restaurants we've never been to. Now we just add on parks we haven't been to, to our itinerary.

The problem with most parks is that they have jungle gym's for kids, but they are almost always for older kids. Julian B Lane easily had the most options for our son's age, which means we will probably be coming back many more times before he gets big enough to play in the big-kid areas.

But even if you're not specifically looking for a place to entertain a one-year old, this park is amazing. It takes advantage of riverfront space that, for some reason, was mostly just sitting dormant, I guess? What did we do with all this riverfront before Armature Works and Julian B Lane started maximizing it? It's an enormous green space, on the river with a skyline backdrop. There are open fields, plenty of fun things for kids and when we visited, there was a Sunday afternoon yoga class happening. 

Basically, unless you just hate being outside, there's something here for everyone.

This is a lovely place to go on a Sunday.  Great for families, even fur families.   The park is part of the Tampa Riverwalk.  The park has fields, basketball courts,  and an awesome playground.  I didn't really explore because I don't have any kids and it's a little weird to watch other people's kids play.  I know I saw a dog park but I can't remember if it's part of the trail or it was part of the park.  

I can say I was honestly caught off guard.  I mean I've heard a lot about it, but never actually stopped.  We were looking to kill some time and thought a walk around the riverwalk was a good idea.  As we walked to the park we got see busts of people who helped shape our wonderful city.  

Will I go back absolutely there is so much more I need to explore.

It's no secret that I am an enormous fan of BDubs and wish there was one around the corner for us. Seeing as how that's not happening any time soon, a visit every now and then is in order. 

This fits the chain well - big space inside, plenty of TVs to watch the NUMEROUS sporting events going on. Our server was terrific, food came out fast. Fried pickes because they are awesome, grilled chicken wrap with parmesean garlic sauce, because that's the jam right there. 

Great location if you're out in Downington - it's right off 30, across from the movie theater, BJs, DSW, etc. It's a very family friendly restaurant.

Wonderful if your a teen, another fried fast food restaurant in my book.  Perfect for watching the big game with a crowd but not exactly my cup of tea.

Only reason I came was that I was dropping off my son at college and I let him choose.  Even my " healthy" salad tasted gloppy.

Great place to go to watch the game and have some delicious wings.

I love the extensive selection of wing sauces. I like menus with a lot of choices and there are definitely choices here. It can be a bit loud here but it is meant to be a sports bar. If you are craving wings and have a game to watch - this is the place to go.

My husband and I came here during a weekday about 20 minutes after they opened. We were the only family in the restaurant. 

My experience was quite strange. Our sever didn't know the menu and she was extremely confused about their lunch specials. It was just an all over weird experience. I felt like I was on the show Punked. 

First off, my chicken came out undercooked. They swore that it was cooked all the way through but I'm almost certain this did not reach 165 degrees when they took it off the grill. To be safe I sent it back and had them make me new chicken. 

All the prices were rung up wrong on our bill. Once again, she was confused. Overall, I don't think I would come back to this location.

I always see this BWWs on my way home from Marsh Creek and I was starving, so I decided to stop.  I came during game day and I must say that they have so many TVs that this is the perfect place you can watch the game with a beer.  However, I got two different plates of wings and one was good, but the other one was terrible and dry.  The service here is really good.

I'm really hoping this Chipotle will iron out their kinks because it has only been here for a few months. This first time I was here a few months ago the lady argued with me and my boyfriend because he called the corn salsa "corn." 

This time, THEY WERE OUT OF CHIPS! How does a Chipotle run out of chips?! One of the main reasons I come here is for the fresh guacamole and chips so I was highly disappointed. I don't know how it can get any worse....but it did, my brown rice that was in the bowl was slightly undercooked. It had that hard underlying taste.

Went here for a quick dinner before meeting friends. Heard it was awesome, and at the back of a dive bar called Erin Rose. Dive Bar...Check! Awesome? HARDLY!

My GF got the Shrimp Poboy, and it was decent. Not the best I've ever had but decent. I was SOOOOOOOOO excited to get the Pork Belly Poboy, with an Asian twist. Well what I got was literally Uneatable. It was 100% FAT. Now I'm not stupid, I realize just how much fat is in a pork belly. Duh. I get it. But, this was literally 100% FAT, no meat at all. It's like they put the fatback in boiling water and served it onto this bun. No kidding. It was AWEFUL! I took 2 bites and said I'm done!

Thank goodness for the Lucky Dogs cart! After a hard night of drinking and not being able to eat this crap, I snarfed down a Lucky Dog and thought that was delicious!

So I do NOT recommend Killer Poboys.....cuz it just may "kill" you!

A couple of friends of mine ate here and we enjoyed what basically was a shrimp bahn mi and the roast beef poboy. Both were great particularly the shrimp poboy. Combined with a great frozen irish coffee for dessert you have one of the best combos you can get in New Orleans.

The only bad about this place is that smoking is allowed indoors. Ugh. 
Tried pork belly and sweet potato and both were delicious! I had originally sought out this place because I read about a duck po boy but apparently that was an old menu item that has since been discontinued.
If I had time, I would have come back more than once. Too bad it wasn't open for breakfast, or on Mon/Tues.

This place was so good we came twice on our weekend in NOLA. I believe they have two locations. This one is a bit hidden since it is located behind Erin Rose. I tried 2 of their Po'Boys:
Seared Gulf Shrimp - Marinated Radish, Carrot, Cucumber, Herbs, Special Sauce. This is different than the shrimp Po'Boys I have had in the past as they were fried. This one is pan seared which is still really good and has that really intense shrimp flavor. I honestly did not miss the fried aspect of it. Really fresh and tasty!

"Dark & Stormy" Pork Belly - NOLA Rum Ginger Glaze with Lime Slaw, Garlic Aioli. I have never hear of a pork belly Po'Boy but this one blew everybody away. The pork belly was full of flavor and it was super tender and juicy! I am dreaming about this sandwich...

That shrimp poboy was better than any bahn mi I've had.  $14?! ouch.  but damn it was good. Huge shrimp perfectly seasoned.  great crusty bread. some kinda tangy sauce.  

I want another right now

I had sprained my ankle pretty bad to the point where I had been on crutches for the past three weeks.  I had planned my NOLA trip for a month, and I didn't want to cancel.  Because I couldn't walk far from the hotel, I used Yelp to find out what's nearby. Thankfully, Killer Poboys was a block away.

Enter the bar and go straight to the back.  That's where you'll find them.  The menu is small, and delicious.  I got the pork belly and the sweet potato the next day.  My sister got the shrimp poboy twice.  

I really liked the flavors, and I liked the banh mi influence.  The pork belly had a sweet glaze, and the sweet potato was both savory and sweet.

The lines get pretty long, so the wait can be awhile.  But it's worth it.

Very original flavors here.  I'd never heard of a meat loaf po'boy, but decided to give it a shot.  I thought it was great and my boyfriend really liked the housemade ranch.

They have four po'boy options and a grilled cheese, running you $8-11.  The sandwiches are pretty large.  I was satisfied after my half (although my boyfriend could have easily consumed more).

The service is quick and they will bring it out to you at the bar.  This place is cash only, so be prepared.

The shrimp poboy is banh mi inspired - with a carrot slaw, sriracha aoili and bread from a Vietnamese bakery. 

Interested in some rich, earthy flavors? The vegan poboy has a black bean spread - similar in texture to refried beans, roasted sweet potatoes and greens. Cumin is pretty present, but damn if it isn't good!

The staff are really nice, and we went twice on my trip to the Big Easy.

When in NOLA celebrating my bachelorette party we had a tour guide of ours recommend this place for po-boys! He said it was a place that not many people know about since it is inside a bar. We knew we had to go. 

When we arrived it was late in the evening and of course we had to give the bouncer our ID's so he could verify that we were old enough to get inside. Once inside (a very small bar) we managed to get in the back to the Killer Po-Boys area and it was packed! So many people squished into the room. It was our turn to order and with my group I think we had one of everything to try. I opted for the "not po-boy" grilled cheese. Others enjoyed the shrimp and pork belly ones. We paid (cash) and while waiting ordered a few drinks at the bar. Eventually the room cleared out and it was just my group and a few others which made it a lot more comfortable. We managed to sit at the only table in the room (maybe 4 chairs total) and of course we took spots at the bar. The bartender was awesome and made sure we had everything we needed. 

Eventually our food started coming out of the kitchen and they were just calling out orders by name. When I heard my name I was excited to try to grilled cheese. It was warm, crunchy, gooey and just what I needed in my life. I split it with my sister which was a good idea since neither of us was too hungry. All the others in my group were telling me how good their po-boys were. The shrimp one had the best reviews! 

I am glad we found this place and I do think I would go back again and try a different one.

My wife and I were on vacation in New Orleans and heard about this hole in the wall that had amazing po' boys. They are literally in the back of a small bar with about 20 seats. I ordered a beer and they brought out my grilled shrimp po' boy and I ate it outside.

The bread was so good, super crusty and chewy with huge chunks of shrimps. The sauce and condiments were so great!

I would highly recommend this place, the bar is very divey, but the service was great.

This place is somewhat hidden in a bar in the bourbon street area. Somewhat surprising for po boy place to be at but I guess that makes for a interesting place for people to drink and then get their fix of goodness. Also they don't accept credit cards so that tends to breaks crownds of college kids but I guess it's not hurting their business. The po boys were great but I wouldn't go back because it feel likes you're in closed quarters without an escape.

Had an excellent fried shrimp po'boy and local beer here. I am no millennial but I sure felt like one scarfing those down in the back room of the bar where this place is located. Lovely young woman working behind the counter. Left quite happy.

Not what I was expecting. Basically this place makes their po boys like banh mi. I wanted a classic po boy since I was in New Orleans for the first time. If you want a twist on a po boy then go for it. Bread is hard just like a banh mi and they have pork belly and shrimp.

Killer Poboys didn't meet my expectations, unfortunately. I got the BBQ Chicken Confit with ranch slaw, coffee, BBQ sauce, and red onions. The bread was the only thing that I liked. The BBQ sauce was tangy, not spicy, completely bland and unimpressive. The slaw was vinegary and sour and did not have the ranch flavor I was expecting. I was disappointed greatly. On the bright side, the customer service and quickness of the to-go order, was worth noting. Great concept of gourmet po' boys but it didn't live up to the hype. Perhaps I got the wrong sandwich, but it was just an okay experience.

I must say that I found out about this place using Yelp. I used to live in NO but left about 8 years ago when this "restaurant" was not there. As previously described this restaurant is in the back of the Erin Rose bar on Conti next to Bourbon in the Quarter. You go through the small bar to go to the even smaller restaurant. They only offer maybe 5-6 versions of po boys at a time so it is a limited menu. I had the pork belly po boy and also ordered the potato salad for a side. Total with tax was $13.  

The po boy is a 7" which seems a little small. However, it was very, very good. I like their bread (it comes from a Vietnamese bakery in NO East) too. The potato salad was also very tasty. 

The "restaurant" has one high table for 4 people. The other seating options are along a bar that adjoins the wall. This place is small. If you want a drink you have to go get it in the bar and pay separately. Also the restaurant only accepts cash.

The chef uses all homemade ingredients...this is NOT your typical po boy shop. It is actually a high end product that you can taste the difference. My favorite po boy is still at The Cajun Stop in Houston however this place comes close.

I highly recommend the pork belly po boy. I am sure the others are equally good too.

Killer Poboys was my very first stop on a 4-day trip in New Orleans. Ordered the gulf shrimp poboy and fell in love! The shrimps were super fresh, lightly seasoned, and cooked to perfection (juicy with a bite)! The pickled veggies (carrots, cucumbers, daikon) made it taste like a Vietnamese sandwich (banh mi). There were some specialty hot sauces, one with serrano chilis, ghost peppers, and habanero to add more flavor and heat. 

Typically when I travel, I don't return to the same eatery, not matter how good, but not Killer Poboys!
